By no means shall they reach thee! now travel with thy family while yet a part of the night remains, and let not any of you look back: but thy wife (will remain behind): To her will happen what happens to the people. Morning is their time appointed: Is not the morning nigh?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: When Our Decree issued, We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay, spread, layer on layer,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Marked as from thy Lord: Nor are they ever far from those who do wrong!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: To the Madyan People (We sent) Shu'aib, one of their own brethren: he said: "O my people! worship Allah: Ye have no other god but Him. And give not short measure or weight: I see you in prosperity, but I fear for you the penalty of a day that will compass (you) all round.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "And O my people! give just measure and weight, nor withhold from the people the things that are their due: commit not evil in the land with intent to do mischief.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "That which is left you by Allah is best for you, if ye (but) believed! but I am not set over you to keep watch!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "O Shu'aib! Does thy (religion of) prayer command thee that we leave off the worship which our fathers practised, or that we leave off doing what we like with our property? truly, thou art the one that forbeareth with faults and is right-minded!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "O my people! see ye whether I have a Clear (Sign) from my Lord, and He hath given me sustenance (pure and) good as from Himself? I wish not, in opposition to you, to do that which I forbid you to do. I only desire (your) betterment to the best of my power; and my success (in my task) can only come from Allah. In Him I trust, and unto Him I look.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: "And O my people! let not my dissent (from you) cause you to sin, lest ye suffer a fate similar to that of the people of Noah or of Hud or of Salih, nor are the people of Lut far off from you!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "But ask forgiveness of your Lord, and turn unto Him (in repentance): For my Lord is indeed full of mercy and loving-kindness."
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "O Shu'aib! much of what thou sayest we do not understand! In fact among us we see that thou hast no strength! Were it not for thy family, we should certainly have stoned thee! for thou hast among us no great position!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "O my people! is then my family of more consideration with you than Allah? For ye cast Him away behind your backs (with contempt). But verily my Lord encompasseth on all sides all that ye do!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "And O my people! Do whatever ye can: I will do (my part): Soon will ye know who it is on whom descends the penalty of ignominy; and who is a liar! and watch ye! for I too am watching with you!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: When Our decree issued, We saved Shu'aib and those who believed with him, by (special) mercy from Ourselves: But the (mighty) blast did seize the wrong-doers, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: As if they had never dwelt and flourished there! Ah! Behold! How the Madyan were removed (from sight) as were removed the Thamud!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And we sent Moses, with Our Clear (Signs) and an authority manifest,
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Unto Pharaoh and his chiefs: but they followed the command of Pharaoh and the command of Pharaoh was no right (guide).
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: He will go before his people on the Day of Judgment, and lead them into the Fire (as cattle are led to water): But woeful indeed will be the place to which they are led!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: And they are followed by a curse in this (life) and on the Day of Judgment: and woeful is the gift which shall be given (unto them)!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: It was not We that wronged them: They wronged their own souls: the deities, other than Allah, whom they invoked, profited them no whit when there issued the decree of thy Lord: Nor did they add aught (to their lot) but perdition!
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Such is the chastisement of thy Lord when He chastises communities in the midst of their wrong: grievous, indeed, and severe is His chastisement.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Nor shall We delay it but for a term appointed.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Those who are wretched shall be in the Fire: There will be for them therein (nothing but) the heaving of sighs and sobs:
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: for thy Lord is the (sure) accomplisher of what He planneth.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And those who are blessed shall be in the Garden: They will dwell therein for all the time that the heavens and the earth endure, except as thy Lord willeth: a gift without break.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Be not then in doubt as to what these men worship. They worship nothing but what their fathers worshipped before (them): but verily We shall pay them back (in full) their portion without (the least) abatement.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: We certainly gave the Book to Moses, but differences arose therein: had it not been that a word had gone forth before from thy Lord, the matter would have been decided between them, but they are in suspicious doubt concerning it.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Therefore stand firm (in the straight Path) as thou art commanded,- thou and those who with thee turn (unto Allah); and transgress not (from the Path): for He seeth well all that ye do.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: And incline not to those who do wrong, or the Fire will seize you; and ye have no protectors other than Allah, nor shall ye be helped.
Label: ['akhlak', 'ilmu', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And establish regular prayers at the two ends of the day and at the approaches of the night: For those things, that are good remove those that are evil: Be that the word of remembrance to those who remember (their Lord):
Label: ['syariah']

Text: And be steadfast in patience; for verily Allah will not suffer the reward of the righteous to perish.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Why were there not, among the generations before you, persons possessed of balanced good sense, prohibiting (men) from mischief in the earth - except a few among them whom We saved (from harm)? But the wrong-doers pursued the enjoyment of the good things of life which were given them, and persisted in sin.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Nor would thy Lord be the One to destroy communities for a single wrong-doing, if its members were likely to mend.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Except those on whom thy Lord hath bestowed His Mercy: and for this did He create them: and the Word of thy Lord shall be fulfilled: "I will fill Hell with jinns and men all together."
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: To Allah do belong the unseen (secrets) of the heavens and the earth, and to Him goeth back every affair (for decision): then worship Him, and put thy trust in Him: and thy Lord is not unmindful of aught that ye do.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: A. L. R. These are the symbols (or Verses) of the perspicuous Book.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an, in order that ye may learn wisdom.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: Behold! Joseph said to his father: "O my father! I did see eleven stars and the sun and the moon: I saw them prostrate themselves to me!"
Label: ['syariah', 'ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Said (the father): "My (dear) little son! relate not thy vision to thy brothers, lest they concoct a plot against thee: for Satan is to man an avowed enemy!
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Thus will thy Lord choose thee and teach thee the interpretation of stories (and events) and perfect His favour to thee and to the posterity of Jacob - even as He perfected it to thy fathers Abraham and Isaac aforetime! for Allah is full of knowledge and wisdom."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (or symbols) for seekers (after Truth).
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "Truly Joseph and his brother are loved more by our father than we: But we are a goodly body! really our father is obviously wandering (in his mind)!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "Slay ye Joseph or cast him out to some (unknown) land, that so the favour of your father may be given to you alone: (there will be time enough) for you to be righteous after that!"
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Said one of them: "Slay not Joseph, but if ye must do something, throw him down to the bottom of the well: he will be picked up by some caravan of travellers."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "O our father! why dost thou not trust us with Joseph,- seeing we are indeed his sincere well-wishers?
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "Send him with us tomorrow to enjoy himself and play, and we shall take every care of him."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: (Jacob) said: "Really it saddens me that ye should take him away: I fear lest the wolf should devour him while ye attend not to him."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "If the wolf were to devour him while we are (so large) a party, then should we indeed (first) have perished ourselves!"
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: So they did take him away, and they all agreed to throw him down to the bottom of the well: and We put into his heart (this Message): 'Of a surety thou shalt (one day) tell them the truth of this their affair while they know (thee) not'
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then they came to their father in the early part of the night, weeping.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "O our father! We went racing with one another, and left Joseph with our things; and the wolf devoured him.... But thou wilt never believe us even though we tell the truth."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: They stained his shirt with false blood. He said: "Nay, but your minds have made up a tale (that may pass) with you, (for me) patience is most fitting: Against that which ye assert, it is Allah (alone) Whose help can be sought"..
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Then there came a caravan of travellers: they sent their water-carrier (for water), and he let down his bucket (into the well)... He said: "Ah there! Good news! Here is a (fine) young man!" So they concealed him as a treasure! But Allah knoweth well all that they do!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: The (Brethren) sold him for a miserable price, for a few dirhams counted out: in such low estimation did they hold him!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: The man in Egypt who bought him, said to his wife: "Make his stay (among us) honourable: may be he will bring us much good, or we shall adopt him as a son." Thus did We establish Joseph in the land, that We might teach him the interpretation of stories (and events). And Allah hath full power and control over His affairs; but most among mankind know it not.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When Joseph attained His full manhood, We gave him power and knowledge: thus do We reward those who do right.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: But she in whose house he was, sought to seduce him from his (true) self: she fastened the doors, and said: "Now come, thou (dear one)!" He said: "Allah forbid! truly (thy husband) is my lord! he made my sojourn agreeable! truly to no good come those who do wrong!"
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: So they both raced each other to the door, and she tore his shirt from the back: they both found her lord near the door. She said: "What is the (fitting) punishment for one who formed an evil design against thy wife, but prison or a grievous chastisement?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "It was she that sought to seduce me - from my (true) self." And one of her household saw (this) and bore witness, (thus):- "If it be that his shirt is rent from the front, then is her tale true, and he is a liar!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "But if it be that his shirt is torn from the back, then is she the liar, and he is telling the truth!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: So when he saw his shirt,- that it was torn at the back,- (her husband) said: "Behold! It is a snare of you women! truly, mighty is your snare!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "O Joseph, pass this over! (O wife), ask forgiveness for thy sin, for truly thou hast been at fault!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Ladies said in the City: "The wife of the (great) 'Aziz is seeking to seduce her slave from his (true) self: Truly hath he inspired her with violent love: we see she is evidently going astray."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When she heard of their malicious talk, she sent for them and prepared a banquet for them: she gave each of them a knife: and she said (to Joseph), "Come out before them." When they saw him, they did extol him, and (in their amazement) cut their hands: they said, "Allah preserve us! no mortal is this! this is none other than a noble angel!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: She said: "There before you is the man about whom ye did blame me! I did seek to seduce him from his (true) self but he did firmly save himself guiltless!.... and now, if he doth not my bidding, he shall certainly be cast into prison, and (what is more) be of the company of the vilest!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: He said: "O my Lord! the prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me: Unless Thou turn away their snare from me, I should (in my youthful folly) feel inclined towards them and join the ranks of the ignorant."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: So his Lord hearkened to him (in his prayer), and turned away from him their snare: Verily He heareth and knoweth (all things).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Then it occurred to the men, after they had seen the signs, (that it was best) to imprison him for a time.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Now with him there came into the prison two young men. Said one of them: "I see myself (in a dream) pressing wine." said the other: "I see myself (in a dream) carrying bread on my head, and birds are eating, thereof." "Tell us" (they said) "The truth and meaning thereof: for we see thou art one that doth good (to all)."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He said: "Before any food comes (in due course) to feed either of you, I will surely reveal to you the truth and meaning of this ere it befall you: that is part of the (duty) which my Lord hath taught me. I have (I assure you) abandoned the ways of a people that believe not in Allah and that (even) deny the Hereafter.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: "And I follow the ways of my fathers,- Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and never could we attribute any partners whatever to Allah: that (comes) of the grace of Allah to us and to mankind: yet most men are not grateful.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "O my two companions of the prison! (I ask you): are many lords differing among themselves better, or the One Allah, Supreme and Irresistible?
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: "If not Him, ye worship nothing but names which ye have named,- ye and your fathers,- for which Allah hath sent down no authority: the command is for none but Allah: He hath commanded that ye worship none but Him: that is the right religion, but most men understand not...
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "O my two companions of the prison! As to one of you, he will pour out the wine for his lord to drink: as for the other, he will hang from the cross, and the birds will eat from off his head. (so) hath been decreed that matter whereof ye twain do enquire"...
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And of the two, to that one whom he consider about to be saved, he said: "Mention me to thy lord." But Satan made him forget to mention him to his lord: and (Joseph) lingered in prison a few (more) years.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: The king (of Egypt) said: "I do see (in a vision) seven fat kine, whom seven lean ones devour, and seven green ears of corn, and seven (others) withered. O ye chiefs! Expound to me my vision if it be that ye can interpret visions."
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "A confused medley of dreams: and we are not skilled in the interpretation of dreams."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: But the man who had been released, one of the two (who had been in prison) and who now bethought him after (so long) a space of time, said: "I will tell you the truth of its interpretation: send ye me (therefore)."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "O Joseph!" (he said) "O man of truth! Expound to us (the dream) of seven fat kine whom seven lean ones devour, and of seven green ears of corn and (seven) others withered: that I may return to the people, and that they may understand."
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: (Joseph) said: "For seven years shall ye diligently sow as is your wont: and the harvests that ye reap, ye shall leave them in the ear,- except a little, of which ye shall eat.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "Then will come after that (period) seven dreadful (years), which will devour what ye shall have laid by in advance for them,- (all) except a little which ye shall have (specially) guarded.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "Then will come after that (period) a year in which the people will have abundant water, and in which they will press (wine and oil)."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: So the king said: "Bring ye him unto me." But when the messenger came to him, (Joseph) said: "Go thou back to thy lord, and ask him, 'What is the state of mind of the ladies who cut their hands'? For my Lord is certainly well aware of their snare."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (The king) said (to the ladies): "What was your affair when ye did seek to seduce Joseph from his (true) self?" The ladies said: "Allah preserve us! no evil know we against him!" Said the 'Aziz's wife: "Now is the truth manifest (to all): it was I who sought to seduce him from his (true) self: He is indeed of those who are (ever) true (and virtuous).
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "This (say I), in order that He may know that I have never been false to him in his absence, and that Allah will never guide the snare of the false ones.
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: "Nor do I absolve my own self (of blame): the (human) soul is certainly prone to evil, unless my Lord do bestow His Mercy: but surely my Lord is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: So the king said: "Bring him unto me; I will take him specially to serve about my own person." Therefore when he had spoken to him, he said: "Be assured this day, thou art, before our own presence, with rank firmly established, and fidelity fully proved!
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: (Joseph) said: "Set me over the store-houses of the land: I will indeed guard them, as one that knows (their importance)."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Thus did We give established power to Joseph in the land, to take possession therein as, when, or where he pleased. We bestow of our Mercy on whom We please, and We suffer not, to be lost, the reward of those who do good.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But verily the reward of the Hereafter is the best, for those who believe, and are constant in righteousness.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Then came Joseph's brethren: they entered his presence, and he knew them, but they knew him not.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And when he had furnished them forth with provisions (suitable) for them, he said: "Bring unto me a brother ye have, of the same father as yourselves, (but a different mother): see ye not that I pay out full measure, and that I do provide the best hospitality?
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "Now if ye bring him not to me, ye shall have no measure (of corn) from me, nor shall ye (even) come near me."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "We shall certainly seek to get our wish about him from his father: Indeed we shall do it."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And (Joseph) told his servants to put their stock-in-trade (with which they had bartered) into their saddle-bags, so they should know it only when they returned to their people, in order that they might come back.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Now when they returned to their father, they said: "O our father! No more measure of grain shall we get (unless we take our brother): So send our brother with us, that we may get our measure; and we will indeed take every care of him."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "Shall I trust you with him with any result other than when I trusted you with his brother aforetime? But Allah is the best to take care (of him), and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!"
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Then when they opened their baggage, they found their stock-in-trade had been returned to them. They said: "O our father! What (more) can we desire? this our stock-in-trade has been returned to us: so we shall get (more) food for our family; We shall take care of our brother; and add (at the same time) a full camel's load (of grain to our provisions). This is but a small quantity.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (Jacob) said: "Never will I send him with you until ye swear a solemn oath to me, in Allah's name, that ye will be sure to bring him back to me unless ye are yourselves hemmed in (and made powerless). And when they had sworn their solemn oath, he said: "Over all that we say, be Allah the witness and guardian!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Further he said: "O my sons! enter not all by one gate: enter ye by different gates. Not that I can profit you aught against Allah (with my advice): None can command except Allah: On Him do I put my trust: and let all that trust put their trust on Him."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And when they entered in the manner their father had enjoined, it did not profit them in the least against (the plan of) Allah: It was but a necessity of Jacob's soul, which he discharged. For he was, by our instruction, full of knowledge (and experience): but most men know not.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Now when they came into Joseph's presence, he received his (full) brother to stay with him. He said (to him): "Behold! I am thy (own) brother; so grieve not at aught of their doings."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: At length when he had furnished them forth with provisions (suitable) for them, he put the drinking cup into his brother's saddle-bag. Then shouted out a crier: "O ye (in) the caravan! behold! ye are thieves, without doubt!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said, turning towards them: "What is it that ye miss?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "We miss the great beaker of the king; for him who produces it, is (the reward of) a camel load; I will be bound by it."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (The brothers) said: "By Allah! well ye know that we came not to make mischief in the land, and we are no thieves!"
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: (The Egyptians) said: "What then shall be the penalty of this, if ye are (proved) to have lied?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "The penalty should be that he in whose saddle-bag it is found, should be held (as bondman) to atone for the (crime). Thus it is we punish the wrong-doers!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: So he began (the search) with their baggage, before (he came to) the baggage of his brother: at length he brought it out of his brother's baggage. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not take his brother by the law of the king except that Allah willed it (so). We raise to degrees (of wisdom) whom We please: but over all endued with knowledge is one, the All-Knowing.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "If he steals, there was a brother of his who did steal before (him)." But these things did Joseph keep locked in his heart, revealing not the secrets to them. He (simply) said (to himself): "Ye are the worse situated; and Allah knoweth best the truth of what ye assert!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "O exalted one! Behold! he has a father, aged and venerable, (who will grieve for him); so take one of us in his place; for we see that thou art (gracious) in doing good."
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "Allah forbid that we take other than him with whom we found our property: indeed (if we did so), we should be acting wrongfully.
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Now when they saw no hope of his (yielding), they held a conference in private. The leader among them said: "Know ye not that your father did take an oath from you in Allah's name, and how, before this, ye did fail in your duty with Joseph? Therefore will I not leave this land until my father permits me, or Allah commands me; and He is the best to command.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "Turn ye back to your father, and say, 'O our father! behold! thy son committed theft! we bear witness only to what we know, and we could not well guard against the unseen!
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "'Ask at the town where we have been and the caravan in which we returned, and (you will find) we are indeed telling the truth.'"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Jacob said: "Nay, but ye have yourselves contrived a story (good enough) for you. So patience is most fitting (for me). Maybe Allah will bring them (back) all to me (in the end). For He is indeed full of knowledge and wisdom."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: And he turned away from them, and said: "How great is my grief for Joseph!" And his eyes became white with sorrow, and he fell into silent melancholy.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "By Allah! (never) wilt thou cease to remember Joseph until thou reach the last extremity of illness, or until thou die!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "I only complain of my distraction and anguish to Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not...
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "O my sons! go ye and enquire about Joseph and his brother, and never give up hope of Allah's Soothing Mercy: truly no one despairs of Allah's Soothing Mercy, except those who have no faith."
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Then, when they came (back) into (Joseph's) presence they said: "O exalted one! distress has seized us and our family: we have (now) brought but scanty capital: so pay us full measure, (we pray thee), and treat it as charity to us: for Allah doth reward the charitable."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "Know ye how ye dealt with Joseph and his brother, not knowing (what ye were doing)?"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "Art thou indeed Joseph?" He said, "I am Joseph, and this is my brother: Allah has indeed been gracious to us (all): behold, he that is righteous and patient,- never will Allah suffer the reward to be lost, of those who do right."
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: They said: "By Allah! indeed has Allah preferred thee above us, and we certainly have been guilty of sin!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "This day let no reproach be (cast) on you: Allah will forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy!
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: "Go with this my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father: he will come to see (clearly). Then come ye (here) to me together with all your family."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: When the caravan left (Egypt), their father said: "I do indeed scent the presence of Joseph: Nay, think me not a dotard."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "By Allah! truly thou art in thine old wandering mind."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then when the bearer of the good news came, He cast (the shirt) over his face, and he forthwith regained clear sight. He said: "Did I not say to you, 'I know from Allah that which ye know not?'"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said: "O our father! ask for us forgiveness for our sins, for we were truly at fault."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "Soon will I ask my Lord for forgiveness for you: for he is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Then when they entered the presence of Joseph, he provided a home for his parents with himself, and said: "Enter ye Egypt (all) in safety if it please Allah."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And he raised his parents high on the throne (of dignity), and they fell down in prostration, (all) before him. He said: "O my father! this is the fulfilment of my vision of old! Allah hath made it come true! He was indeed good to me when He took me out of prison and brought you (all here) out of the desert, (even) after Satan had sown enmity between me and my brothers. Verily my Lord understandeth best the mysteries of all that He planneth to do, for verily He is full of knowledge and wisdom.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "O my Lord! Thou hast indeed bestowed on me some power, and taught me something of the interpretation of dreams and events,- O Thou Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protector in this world and in the Hereafter. Take Thou my soul (at death) as one submitting to Thy will (as a Muslim), and unite me with the righteous."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Such is one of the stories of what happened unseen, which We reveal by inspiration unto thee; nor wast thou (present) with them then when they concerted their plans together in the process of weaving their plots.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Yet no faith will the greater part of mankind have, however ardently thou dost desire it.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And how many Signs in the heavens and the earth do they pass by? Yet they turn (their faces) away from them!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: And most of them believe not in Allah without associating (other as partners) with Him!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Do they then feel secure from the coming against them of the covering veil of the wrath of Allah,- or of the coming against them of the (final) Hour all of a sudden while they perceive not?
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Say thou: "This is my way: I do invite unto Allah,- on evidence clear as the seeing with one's eyes,- I and whoever follows me. Glory to Allah! and never will I join gods with Allah!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Nor did We send before thee (as messengers) any but men, whom we did inspire,- (men) living in human habitations. Do they not travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those before them? But the home of the hereafter is best, for those who do right. Will ye not then understand?
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: (Respite will be granted) until, when the messengers give up hope (of their people) and (come to) think that they were treated as liars, there reaches them Our help, and those whom We will are delivered into safety. But never will be warded off our punishment from those who are in sin.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: There is, in their stories, instruction for men endued with understanding. It is not a tale invented, but a confirmation of what went before it,- a detailed exposition of all things, and a guide and a mercy to any such as believe.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: A. L. M. R. These are the signs (or verses) of the Book: that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the Truth; but most men believe not.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Allah is He Who raised the heavens without any pillars that ye can see; is firmly established on the throne (of authority); He has subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law)! Each one runs (its course) for a term appointed. He doth regulate all affairs, explaining the signs in detail, that ye may believe with certainty in the meeting with your Lord.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And it is He who spread out the earth, and set thereon mountains standing firm and (flowing) rivers: and fruit of every kind He made in pairs, two and two: He draweth the night as a veil o'er the Day. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who consider!
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And in the earth are tracts (diverse though) neighbouring, and gardens of vines and fields sown with corn, and palm trees - growing out of single roots or otherwise: watered with the same water, yet some of them We make more excellent than others to eat. Behold, verily in these things there are signs for those who understand!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: If thou dost marvel (at their want of faith), strange is their saying: "When we are (actually) dust, shall we indeed then be in a creation renewed?" They are those who deny their Lord! They are those round whose necks will be yokes (of servitude): they will be Companions of the Fire, to dwell therein (for aye)!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: They ask thee to hasten on the evil in preference to the good: Yet have come to pass, before them, (many) exemplary punishments! But verily thy Lord is full of forgiveness for mankind for their wrong-doing, and verily thy Lord is (also) strict in punishment.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: He knoweth the unseen and that which is open: He is the Great, the Most High.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: It is He Who doth show you the lightning, by way both of fear and of hope: It is He Who doth raise up the clouds, heavy with (fertilising) rain!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Nay, thunder repeateth His praises, and so do the angels, with awe: He flingeth the loud-voiced thunder-bolts, and therewith He striketh whomsoever He will.. yet these (are the men) who (dare to) dispute about Allah, with the strength of His power (supreme)!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: For Him (alone) is prayer in Truth: any others that they call upon besides Him hear them no more than if they were to stretch forth their hands for water to reach their mouths but it reaches them not: for the prayer of those without Faith is nothing but (futile) wandering (in the mind).
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Whatever beings there are in the heavens and the earth do prostrate themselves to Allah (Acknowledging subjection),- with good-will or in spite of themselves: so do their shadows in the morning and evenings.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Say: "Who is the Lord and Sustainer of the heavens and the earth?" Say: "(It is) Allah." Say: "Do ye then take (for worship) protectors other than Him, such as have no power either for good or for harm to themselves?" Say: "Are the blind equal with those who see? Or the depths of darkness equal with light?" Or do they assign to Allah partners who have created (anything) as He has created, so that the creation seemed to them similar? Say: "Allah is the Creator of all things: He is the One, the Supreme and Irresistible."
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He sends down water from the skies, and the channels flow, each according to its measure: But the torrent bears away to foam that mounts up to the surface. Even so, from that (ore) which they heat in the fire, to make ornaments or utensils therewith, there is a scum likewise. Thus doth Allah (by parables) show forth Truth and Vanity. For the scum disappears like forth cast out; while that which is for the good of mankind remains on the earth. Thus doth Allah set forth parables.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: For those who respond to their Lord, are (all) good things. But those who respond not to Him,- Even if they had all that is in the heavens and on earth, and as much more, (in vain) would they offer it for ransom. For them will the reckoning be terrible: their abode will be Hell,- what a bed of misery!
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Is then one who doth know that that which hath been revealed unto thee from thy Lord is the Truth, like one who is blind? It is those who are endued with understanding that receive admonition;-
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Those who fulfil the covenant of Allah and fail not in their plighted word;
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Those who patiently persevere, seeking the countenance of their Lord; Establish regular prayers; spend, out of (the gifts) We have bestowed for their sustenance, secretly and openly; and turn off Evil with good: for such there is the final attainment of the (eternal) home,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Gardens of perpetual bliss: they shall enter there, as well as the righteous among their fathers, their spouses, and their offspring: and angels shall enter unto them from every gate (with the salutation):
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: "Peace unto you for that ye persevered in patience! Now how excellent is the final home!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: But those who break the Covenant of Allah, after having plighted their word thereto, and cut asunder those things which Allah has commanded to be joined, and work mischief in the land;- on them is the curse; for them is the terrible home!
Label: ['syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Allah doth enlarge, or grant by (strict) measure, the sustenance (which He giveth) to whomso He pleaseth. (The wordly) rejoice in the life of this world: But the life of this world is but little comfort in the Hereafter.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: The Unbelievers say: "Why is not a sign sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Truly Allah leaveth, to stray, whom He will; But He guideth to Himself those who turn to Him in penitence,-
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: "Those who believe, and whose hearts find satisfaction in the remembrance of Allah: for without doubt in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find satisfaction.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: "For those who believe and work righteousness, is (every) blessedness, and a beautiful place of (final) return."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Thus have we sent thee amongst a People before whom (long since) have (other) Peoples (gone and) passed away; in order that thou mightest rehearse unto them what We send down unto thee by inspiration; yet do they reject (Him), the Most Gracious! Say: "He is my Lord! There is no god but He! On Him is my trust, and to Him do I turn!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: If there were a Qur'an with which mountains were moved, or the earth were cloven asunder, or the dead were made to speak, (this would be the one!) But, truly, the command is with Allah in all things! Do not the Believers know, that, had Allah (so) willed, He could have guided all mankind (to the right)? But the Unbelievers,- never will disaster cease to seize them for their (ill) deeds, or to settle close to their homes, until the promise of Allah come to pass, for, verily, Allah will not fail in His promise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Is then He who standeth over every soul (and knoweth) all that it doth, (like any others)? And yet they ascribe partners to Allah. Say: "But name them! is it that ye will inform Him of something he knoweth not on earth, or is it (just) a show of words?" Nay! to those who believe not, their pretence seems pleasing, but they are kept back (thereby) from the path. And those whom Allah leaves to stray, no one can guide.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: The parable of the Garden which the righteous are promised!- beneath it flow rivers: perpetual is the enjoyment thereof and the shade therein: such is the end of the Righteous; and the end of Unbelievers in the Fire.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Those to whom We have given the Book rejoice at what hath been revealed unto thee: but there are among the clans those who reject a part thereof. Say: "I am commanded to worship Allah, and not to join partners with Him. Unto Him do I call, and unto Him is my return."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Thus have We revealed it to be a judgment of authority in Arabic. Wert thou to follow their (vain) desires after the knowledge which hath reached thee, then wouldst thou find neither protector nor defender against Allah.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We did send messengers before thee, and appointed for them wives and children: and it was never the part of a messenger to bring a sign except as Allah permitted (or commanded). For each period is a Book (revealed).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? (Where) Allah commands, there is none to put back His Command: and He is swift in calling to account.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Those before them did (also) devise plots; but in all things the master-planning is Allah's He knoweth the doings of every soul: and soon will the Unbelievers know who gets home in the end.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: The Unbelievers say: "No messenger art thou." Say: "Enough for a witness between me and you is Allah, and such as have knowledge of the Book."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: A. L. R. A Book which We have revealed unto thee, in order that thou mightest lead mankind out of the depths of darkness into light - by the leave of their Lord - to the Way of (Him) the Exalted in power, worthy of all praise!-
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Of Allah, to Whom do belong all things in the heavens and on earth! But alas for the Unbelievers for a terrible penalty (their Unfaith will bring them)!-
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: We sent not a messenger except (to teach) in the language of his (own) people, in order to make (things) clear to them. Now Allah leaves straying those whom He pleases and guides whom He pleases: and He is Exalted in power, full of Wisdom.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: We sent Moses with Our signs (and the command). "Bring out thy people from the depths of darkness into light, and teach them to remember the Days of Allah." Verily in this there are Signs for such as are firmly patient and constant,- grateful and appreciative.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: Remember! Moses said to his people: "Call to mind the favour of Allah to you when He delivered you from the people of Pharaoh: they set you hard tasks and punishments, slaughtered your sons, and let your women-folk live: therein was a tremendous trial from your Lord."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And remember! your Lord caused to be declared (publicly): "If ye are grateful, I will add more (favours) unto you; But if ye show ingratitude, truly My punishment is terrible indeed."
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: And Moses said: "If ye show ingratitude, ye and all on earth together, yet is Allah free of all wants, worthy of all praise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Has not the story reached you, (O people!), of those who (went) before you? - of the people of Noah, and 'Ad, and Thamud? - And of those who (came) after them? None knows them but Allah. To them came messengers with Clear (Signs); but they put their hands up to their mouths, and said: "We do deny (the mission) on which ye have been sent, and we are really in suspicious (disquieting) doubt as to that to which ye invite us."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Their messengers said: "Is there a doubt about Allah, The Creator of the heavens and the earth? It is He Who invites you, in order that He may forgive you your sins and give you respite for a term appointed!" They said: "Ah! ye are no more than human, like ourselves! Ye wish to turn us away from the (gods) our fathers used to worship: then bring us some clear authority."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Their messengers said to them: "True, we are human like yourselves, but Allah doth grant His grace to such of his servants as He pleases. It is not for us to bring you an authority except as Allah permits. And on Allah let all men of faith put their trust.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: "No reason have we why we should not put our trust on Allah. Indeed He Has guided us to the Ways we (follow). We shall certainly bear with patience all the hurt you may cause us. For those who put their trust should put their trust on Allah."
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: And the Unbelievers said to their messengers: "Be sure we shall drive you out of our land, or ye shall return to our religion." But their Lord inspired (this Message) to them: "Verily We shall cause the wrong-doers to perish!
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "And verily We shall cause you to abide in the land, and succeed them. This for such as fear the Time when they shall stand before My tribunal,- such as fear the punishment denounced."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But they sought victory and decision (there and then), and frustration was the lot of every powerful obstinate transgressor.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: In front of such a one is Hell, and he is given, for drink, boiling fetid water.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: In gulps will he sip it, but never will he be near swallowing it down his throat: death will come to him from every quarter, yet will he not die: and in front of him will be a chastisement unrelenting.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: The parable of those who reject their Lord is that their works are as ashes, on which the wind blows furiously on a tempestuous day: No power have they over aught that they have earned: that is the straying far, far (from the goal).
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Seest thou not that Allah created the heavens and the earth in Truth? If He so will, He can remove you and put (in your place) a new creation?
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And Satan will say when the matter is decided: "It was Allah Who gave you a promise of Truth: I too promised, but I failed in my promise to you. I had no authority over you except to call you but ye listened to me: then reproach not me, but reproach your own souls. I cannot listen to your cries, nor can ye listen to mine. I reject your former act in associating me with Allah. For wrong-doers there must be a grievous penalty."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: But those who believe and work righteousness will be admitted to gardens beneath which rivers flow,- to dwell therein for aye with the leave of their Lord. Their greeting therein will be: "Peace!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Seest thou not how Allah sets forth a parable? - A goodly word like a goodly tree, whose root is firmly fixed, and its branches (reach) to the heavens,- of its Lord. So Allah sets forth parables for men, in order that they may receive admonition.
Label: ['ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It brings forth its fruit at all times, by the leave of its Lord. So Allah sets forth parables for men, in order that they may receive admonition.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: And the parable of an evil Word is that of an evil tree: It is torn up by the root from the surface of the earth: it has no stability.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Allah will establish in strength those who believe, with the word that stands firm, in this world and in the Hereafter; but Allah will leave, to stray, those who do wrong: Allah doeth what He willeth.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Hast thou not turned thy vision to those who have changed the favour of Allah. Into blasphemy and caused their people to descend to the House of Perdition?-
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Into Hell? They will burn therein,- an evil place to stay in!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: And they set up (idols) as equal to Allah, to mislead (men) from the Path! Say: "Enjoy (your brief power)! But verily ye are making straightway for Hell!"
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Speak to my servants who have believed, that they may establish regular prayers, and spend (in charity) out of the sustenance we have given them, secretly and openly, before the coming of a Day in which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor befriending.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: It is Allah Who hath created the heavens and the earth and sendeth down rain from the skies, and with it bringeth out fruits wherewith to feed you; it is He Who hath made the ships subject to you, that they may sail through the sea by His command; and the rivers (also) hath He made subject to you.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And He hath made subject to you the sun and the moon, both diligently pursuing their courses; and the night and the day hath he (also) made subject to you.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And He giveth you of all that ye ask for. But if ye count the favours of Allah, never will ye be able to number them. Verily, man is given up to injustice and ingratitude.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Remember Abraham said: "O my Lord! make this city one of peace and security: and preserve me and my sons from worshipping idols.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "O my Lord! they have indeed led astray many among mankind; He then who follows my (ways) is of me, and he that disobeys me,- but Thou art indeed Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "O our Lord! I have made some of my offspring to dwell in a valley without cultivation, by Thy Sacred House; in order, O our Lord, that they may establish regular Prayer: so fill the hearts of some among men with love towards them, and feed them with fruits: so that they may give thanks.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "O our Lord! truly Thou dost know what we conceal and what we reveal: for nothing whatever is hidden from Allah, whether on earth or in heaven.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "Praise be to Allah, Who hath granted unto me in old age Isma'il and Isaac: for truly my Lord is He, the Hearer of Prayer!
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: O my Lord! make me one who establishes regular Prayer, and also (raise such) among my offspring O our Lord! and accept Thou my Prayer.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "O our Lord! cover (us) with Thy Forgiveness - me, my parents, and (all) Believers, on the Day that the Reckoning will be established!
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Think not that Allah doth not heed the deeds of those who do wrong. He but giveth them respite against a Day when the eyes will fixedly stare in horror,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: "And ye dwelt in the dwellings of men who wronged their own souls; ye were clearly shown how We dealt with them; and We put forth (many) parables in your behoof!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Mighty indeed were the plots which they made, but their plots were (well) within the sight of Allah, even though they were such as to shake the hills!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Never think that Allah would fail his messengers in His promise: for Allah is Exalted in power, - the Lord of Retribution.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: One day the earth will be changed to a different earth, and so will be the heavens, and (men) will be marshalled forth, before Allah, the One, the Irresistible;
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: That Allah may requite each soul according to its deserts; and verily Allah is swift in calling to account.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Here is a Message for mankind: Let them take warning therefrom, and let them know that He is (no other than) One Allah: let men of understanding take heed.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: A. L. R. These are the Ayats of Revelation,- of a Qur'an that makes things clear.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Neither can a people anticipate its term, nor delay it.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! truly thou art mad (or possessed)!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came (to the ungodly), behold! no respite would they have!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: We have, without doubt, sent down the Message; and We will assuredly guard it (from corruption).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We did send messengers before thee amongst the religious sects of old:
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: But never came a messenger to them but they mocked him.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven, and they were to continue (all day) ascending therein,
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: It is We Who have set out the zodiacal signs in the heavens, and made them fair-seeming to (all) beholders;
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And (moreover) We have guarded them from every cursed devil:
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And We have provided therein means of subsistence,- for you and for those for whose sustenance ye are not responsible.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures (inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due and ascertainable measures.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And We send the fecundating winds, then cause the rain to descend from the sky, therewith providing you with water (in abundance), though ye are not the guardians of its stores.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And verily, it is We Who give life, and Who give death: it is We Who remain inheritors (after all else passes away).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And the Jinn race, We had created before, from the fire of a scorching wind.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Allah) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among those who prostrated themselves?"
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Allah) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected, accursed.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: (Allah) said: "Respite is granted thee
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
Label: ['ilmu', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of Allah)?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: They said: "Yea, we have come to thee to accomplish that of which they doubt.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due, and assuredly we tell the truth.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Then travel by night with thy household, when a portion of the night (yet remains), and do thou bring up the rear: let no one amongst you look back, but pass on whither ye are ordered."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And We made known this decree to him, that the last remnants of those (sinners) should be cut off by the morning.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: "But fear Allah, and shame me not."
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: He said: "There are my daughters (to marry), if ye must act (so)."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Verily, by thy life (O Prophet), in their wild intoxication, they wander in distraction, to and fro.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning,
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: So We exacted retribution from them. They were both on an open highway, plain to see.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, but for just ends. And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be manifest). So overlook (any human faults) with gracious forgiveness.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: For verily it is thy Lord who is the Master-Creator, knowing all things.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-repeated (verses) and the Grand Qur'an.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Therefore, by the Lord, We will, of a surety, call them to account,
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: For all their deeds.
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Therefore expound openly what thou art commanded, and turn away from those who join false gods with Allah.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Those who adopt, with Allah, another god: but soon will they come to know.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: But celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves in adoration.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: And serve thy Lord until there come unto thee the Hour that is Certain.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (Inevitable) cometh (to pass) the Command of Allah: seek ye not then to hasten it: Glory to Him, and far is He above having the partners they ascribe unto Him!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: He doth send down His angels with inspiration of His Command, to such of His servants as He pleaseth, (saying): "Warn (Man) that there is no god but I: so do your duty unto Me."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: He has created the heavens and the earth for just ends: Far is He above having the partners they ascribe to Him!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He has created man from a sperm-drop; and behold this same (man) becomes an open disputer!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys, for you to ride and use for show; and He has created (other) things of which ye have no knowledge.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: It is He who sends down rain from the sky: from it ye drink, and out of it (grows) the vegetation on which ye feed your cattle.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: With it He produces for you corn, olives, date-palms, grapes and every kind of fruit: verily in this is a sign for those who give thought.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: He has made subject to you the Night and the Day; the sun and the moon; and the stars are in subjection by His Command: verily in this are Signs for men who are wise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And the things on this earth which He has multiplied in varying colours (and qualities): verily in this is a sign for men who celebrate the praises of Allah (in gratitude).
Label: ['ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It is He Who has made the sea subject, that ye may eat thereof flesh that is fresh and tender, and that ye may extract therefrom ornaments to wear; and thou seest the ships therein that plough the waves, that ye may seek (thus) of the bounty of Allah and that ye may be grateful.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And He has set up on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with you; and rivers and roads; that ye may guide yourselves;
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And marks and sign-posts; and by the stars (men) guide themselves.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Those whom they invoke besides Allah create nothing and are themselves created.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Your Allah is one Allah: as to those who believe not in the Hereafter, their hearts refuse to know, and they are arrogant.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Undoubtedly Allah doth know what they conceal, and what they reveal: verily He loveth not the arrogant.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: When it is said to them, "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" they say, "Tales of the ancients!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Then, on the Day of Judgment, He will cover them with shame, and say: "Where are My 'partners' concerning whom ye used to dispute (with the godly)?" Those endued with knowledge will say: "This Day, indeed, are the Unbelievers covered with shame and misery,-
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: "(Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of wrong-doing to their own souls." Then would they offer submission (with the pretence), "We did no evil (knowingly)." (The angels will reply), "Nay, but verily Allah knoweth all that ye did;
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "So enter the gates of Hell, to dwell therein. Thus evil indeed is the abode of the arrogant."
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: To the righteous (when) it is said, "What is it that your Lord has revealed?" they say, "All that is good." To those who do good, there is good in this world, and the Home of the Hereafter is even better and excellent indeed is the Home of the righteous,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Gardens of Eternity which they will enter: beneath them flow (pleasant) rivers: they will have therein all that they wish: thus doth Allah reward the righteous,-
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: (Namely) those whose lives the angels take in a state of purity, saying (to them), "Peace be on you; enter ye the Garden, because of (the good) which ye did (in the world)."
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Do the (ungodly) wait until the angels come to them, or there comes the Command of thy Lord (for their doom)? So did those who went before them. But Allah wronged them not: nay, they wronged their own souls.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: For We assuredly sent amongst every People a messenger, (with the Command), "Serve Allah, and eschew Evil": of the People were some whom Allah guided, and some on whom error became inevitably (established). So travel through the earth, and see what was the end of those who denied (the Truth).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: If thou art anxious for their guidance, yet Allah guideth not such as He leaves to stray, and there is none to help them.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: They swear their strongest oaths by Allah, that Allah will not raise up those who die: Nay, but it is a promise (binding) on Him in truth: but most among mankind realise it not.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: For to anything which We have willed, We but say the word, "Be", and it is.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: To those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah, after suffering oppression,- We will assuredly give a goodly home in this world; but truly the reward of the Hereafter will be greater. If they only realised (this)!
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: (They are) those who persevere in patience, and put their trust on their Lord.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: And before thee also the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: if ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: (We sent them) with Clear Signs and Books of dark prophecies; and We have sent down unto thee (also) the Message; that thou mayest explain clearly to men what is sent for them, and that they may give thought.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: Do then those who devise evil (plots) feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them up, or that the Wrath will not seize them from directions they little perceive?-
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Do they not look at Allah's creation, (even) among (inanimate) things,- How their (very) shadows turn round, from the right and the left, prostrating themselves to Allah, and that in the humblest manner?
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: And to Allah doth obeisance all that is in the heavens and on earth, whether moving (living) creatures or the angels: for none are arrogant (before their Lord).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: They all revere their Lord, high above them, and they do all that they are commanded.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Allah has said: "Take not (for worship) two gods: for He is just One Allah: then fear Me (and Me alone)."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and on earth, and to Him is duty due always: then will ye fear other than Allah?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And ye have no good thing but is from Allah: and moreover, when ye are touched by distress, unto Him ye cry with groans;
Label: ['syariah']

Text: And they (even) assign, to things they do not know, a portion out of that which We have bestowed for their sustenance! By Allah, ye shall certainly be called to account for your false inventions.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: To those who believe not in the Hereafter, applies the similitude of evil: to Allah applies the highest similitude: for He is the Exalted in Power, full of Wisdom.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: If Allah were to punish men for their wrong-doing, He would not leave, on the (earth), a single living creature: but He gives them respite for a stated Term: When their Term expires, they would not be able to delay (the punishment) for a single hour, just as they would not be able to anticipate it (for a single hour).
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They attribute to Allah what they hate (for themselves), and their tongues assert the falsehood that all good things are for themselves: without doubt for them is the Fire, and they will be the first to be hastened on into it!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: By Allah, We (also) sent (Our messengers) to Peoples before thee; but Satan made, (to the wicked), their own acts seem alluring: He is also their patron today, but they shall have a most grievous penalty.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And We sent down the Book to thee for the express purpose, that thou shouldst make clear to them those things in which they differ, and that it should be a guide and a mercy to those who believe.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: And Allah sends down rain from the skies, and gives therewith life to the earth after its death: verily in this is a Sign for those who listen.
Label: ['ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And from the fruit of the date-palm and the vine, ye get out wholesome drink and food: behold, in this also is a sign for those who are wise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And thy Lord taught the Bee to build its cells in hills, on trees, and in (men's) habitations;
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Then to eat of all the produce (of the earth), and find with skill the spacious paths of its Lord: there issues from within their bodies a drink of varying colours, wherein is healing for men: verily in this is a Sign for those who give thought.
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: It is Allah who creates you and takes your souls at death; and of you there are some who are sent back to a feeble age, so that they know nothing after having known (much): for Allah is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Allah has bestowed His gifts of sustenance more freely on some of you than on others: those more favoured are not going to throw back their gifts to those whom their right hands possess, so as to be equal in that respect. Will they then deny the favours of Allah?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And Allah has made for you mates (and companions) of your own nature, and made for you, out of them, sons and daughters and grandchildren, and provided for you sustenance of the best: will they then believe in vain things, and be ungrateful for Allah's favours?-
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And worship others than Allah,- such as have no power of providing them, for sustenance, with anything in heavens or earth, and cannot possibly have such power?
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Allah sets forth the Parable (of two men: one) a slave under the dominion of another; He has no power of any sort; and (the other) a man on whom We have bestowed goodly favours from Ourselves, and he spends thereof (freely), privately and publicly: are the two equal? (By no means;) praise be to Allah. But most of them understand not.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: To Allah belongeth the Mystery of the heavens and the earth. And the Decision of the Hour (of Judgment) is as the twingkling of an eye, or even quicker: for Allah hath power over all things.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: It is He Who brought you forth from the wombs of your mothers when ye knew nothing; and He gave you hearing and sight and intelligence and affections: that ye may give thanks (to Allah).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Do they not look at the birds, held poised in the midst of (the air and) the sky? Nothing holds them up but (the power of) Allah. Verily in this are signs for those who believe.
Label: ['ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It is Allah Who made your habitations homes of rest and quiet for you; and made for you, out of the skins of animals, (tents for) dwellings, which ye find so light (and handy) when ye travel and when ye stop (in your travels); and out of their wool, and their soft fibres (between wool and hair), and their hair, rich stuff and articles of convenience (to serve you) for a time.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It is Allah Who made out of the things He created, some things to give you shade; of the hills He made some for your shelter; He made you garments to protect you from heat, and coats of mail to protect you from your (mutual) violence. Thus does He complete His favours on you, that ye may bow to His Will (in Islam).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They recognise the favours of Allah; then they deny them; and most of them are (creatures) ungrateful.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: One day We shall raise from all Peoples a witness against them, from amongst themselves: and We shall bring thee as a witness against these (thy people): and We have sent down to thee the Book explaining all things, a Guide, a Mercy, and Glad Tidings to Muslims.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Fulfil the Covenant of Allah when ye have entered into it, and break not your oaths after ye have confirmed them; indeed ye have made Allah your surety; for Allah knoweth all that ye do.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: If Allah so willed, He could make you all one people: But He leaves straying whom He pleases, and He guides whom He pleases: but ye shall certainly be called to account for all your actions.
Label: ['akhlak', 'ilmu']

Text: Nor sell the covenant of Allah for a miserable price: for with Allah is (a prize) far better for you, if ye only knew.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: What is with you must vanish: what is with Allah will endure. And We will certainly bestow, on those who patiently persevere, their reward according to the best of their actions.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Whoever works righteousness, man or woman, and has Faith, verily, to him will We give a new Life, a life that is good and pure and We will bestow on such their reward according to the best of their actions.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: When thou dost read the Qur'an, seek Allah's protection from Satan the rejected one.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: No authority has he over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: His authority is over those only, who take him as patron and who join partners with Allah.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: When We substitute one revelation for another,- and Allah knows best what He reveals (in stages),- they say, "Thou art but a forger": but most of them understand not.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Say, the Holy Spirit has brought the revelation from thy Lord in Truth, in order to strengthen those who believe, and as a Guide and Glad Tidings to Muslims.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We know indeed that they say, "It is a man that teaches him." The tongue of him they wickedly point to is notably foreign, while this is Arabic, pure and clear.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Any one who, after accepting faith in Allah, utters Unbelief,- except under compulsion, his heart remaining firm in Faith - but such as open their breast to Unbelief, on them is Wrath from Allah, and theirs will be a dreadful Penalty.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: This because they love the life of this world better than the Hereafter: and Allah will not guide those who reject Faith.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Those are they whose hearts, ears, and eyes Allah has sealed up, and they take no heed.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Without doubt, in the Hereafter they will perish.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: One Day every soul will come up struggling for itself, and every soul will be recompensed (fully) for all its actions, and none will be unjustly dealt with.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Allah sets forth a Parable: a city enjoying security and quiet, abundantly supplied with sustenance from every place: Yet was it ungrateful for the favours of Allah: so Allah made it taste of hunger and terror (in extremes) (closing in on it) like a garment (from every side), because of the (evil) which (its people) wrought.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He has only forbidden you dead meat, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and any (food) over which the name of other than Allah has been invoked. But if one is forced by necessity, without wilful disobedience, nor transgressing due limits,- then Allah is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But say not - for any false thing that your tongues may put forth,- "This is lawful, and this is forbidden," so as to ascribe false things to Allah. For those who ascribe false things to Allah, will never prosper.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: But verily thy Lord,- to those who do wrong in ignorance, but who thereafter repent and make amends,- thy Lord, after all this, is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Abraham was indeed a model, devoutly obedient to Allah, (and) true in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah:
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: He showed his gratitude for the favours of Allah, who chose him, and guided him to a Straight Way.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And We gave him Good in this world, and he will be, in the Hereafter, in the ranks of the Righteous.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: So We have taught thee the inspired (Message), "Follow the ways of Abraham the True in Faith, and he joined not gods with Allah."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: The Sabbath was only made (strict) for those who disagreed (as to its observance); But Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment, as to their differences.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Invite (all) to the Way of thy Lord with wisdom and beautiful preaching; and argue with them in ways that are best and most gracious: for thy Lord knoweth best, who have strayed from His Path, and who receive guidance.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: And if ye do catch them out, catch them out no worse than they catch you out: But if ye show patience, that is indeed the best (course) for those who are patient.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: And do thou be patient, for thy patience is but from Allah; nor grieve over them: and distress not thyself because of their plots.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: For Allah is with those who restrain themselves, and those who do good.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Glory to (Allah) Who did take His servant for a Journey by night from the Sacred Mosque to the farthest Mosque, whose precincts We did bless,- in order that We might show him some of Our Signs: for He is the One Who heareth and seeth (all things).
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: We gave Moses the Book, and made it a Guide to the Children of Israel, (commanding): "Take not other than Me as Disposer of (your) affairs."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: O ye that are sprung from those whom We carried (in the Ark) with Noah! Verily he was a devotee most grateful.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And We gave (Clear) Warning to the Children of Israel in the Book, that twice would they do mischief on the earth and be elated with mighty arrogance (and twice would they be punished)!
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']
