Text: When the first of the warnings came to pass, We sent against you Our servants given to terrible warfare: They entered the very inmost parts of your homes; and it was a warning (completely) fulfilled.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Then did We grant you the Return as against them: We gave you increase in resources and sons, and made you the more numerous in man-power.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: If ye did well, ye did well for yourselves; if ye did evil, (ye did it) against yourselves. So when the second of the warnings came to pass, (We permitted your enemies) to disfigure your faces, and to enter your Temple as they had entered it before, and to visit with destruction all that fell into their power.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: It may be that your Lord may (yet) show Mercy unto you; but if ye revert (to your sins), We shall revert (to Our punishments): And we have made Hell a prison for those who reject (all Faith).
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Verily this Qur'an doth guide to that which is most right (or stable), and giveth the Glad Tidings to the Believers who work deeds of righteousness, that they shall have a magnificent reward;
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: And to those who believe not in the Hereafter, (it announceth) that We have prepared for them a Penalty Grievous (indeed).
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: The prayer that man should make for good, he maketh for evil; for man is given to hasty (deeds).
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: We have made the Night and the Day as two (of Our) Signs: the Sign of the Night have We obscured, while the Sign of the Day We have made to enlighten you; that ye may seek bounty from your Lord, and that ye may know the number and count of the years: all things have We explained in detail.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Every man's fate We have fastened on his own neck: On the Day of Judgment We shall bring out for him a scroll, which he will see spread open.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: (It will be said to him:) "Read thine (own) record: Sufficient is thy soul this day to make out an account against thee."
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Who receiveth guidance, receiveth it for his own benefit: who goeth astray doth so to his own loss: No bearer of burdens can bear the burden of another: nor would We visit with Our Wrath until We had sent an messenger (to give warning).
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: When We decide to destroy a population, We (first) send a definite order to those among them who are given the good things of this life and yet transgress; so that the word is proved true against them: then (it is) We destroy them utterly.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: How many generations have We destroyed after Noah? and enough is thy Lord to note and see the sins of His servants.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: If any do wish for the transitory things (of this life), We readily grant them - such things as We will, to such person as We will: in the end have We provided Hell for them: they will burn therein, disgraced and rejected.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Those who do wish for the (things of) the Hereafter, and strive therefor with all due striving, and have Faith,- they are the ones whose striving is acceptable (to Allah).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: See how We have bestowed more on some than on others; but verily the Hereafter is more in rank and gradation and more in excellence.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Take not with Allah another object of worship; or thou (O man!) wilt sit in disgrace and destitution.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Thy Lord hath decreed that ye worship none but Him, and that ye be kind to parents. Whether one or both of them attain old age in thy life, say not to them a word of contempt, nor repel them, but address them in terms of honour.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And, out of kindness, lower to them the wing of humility, and say: "My Lord! bestow on them thy Mercy even as they cherished me in childhood."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Your Lord knoweth best what is in your hearts: If ye do deeds of righteousness, verily He is Most Forgiving to those who turn to Him again and again (in true penitence).
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: And render to the kindred their due rights, as (also) to those in want, and to the wayfarer: But squander not (your wealth) in the manner of a spendthrift.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Verily spendthrifts are brothers of the Evil Ones; and the Evil One is to his Lord (himself) ungrateful.
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Verily thy Lord doth provide sustenance in abundance for whom He pleaseth, and He provideth in a just measure. For He doth know and regard all His servants.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: Kill not your children for fear of want: We shall provide sustenance for them as well as for you. Verily the killing of them is a great sin.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Nor come nigh to adultery: for it is a shameful (deed) and an evil, opening the road (to other evils).
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Nor take life - which Allah has made sacred - except for just cause. And if anyone is slain wrongfully, we have given his heir authority (to demand qisas or to forgive): but let him not exceed bounds in the matter of taking life; for he is helped (by the Law).
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Come not nigh to the orphan's property except to improve it, until he attains the age of full strength; and fulfil (every) engagement, for (every) engagement will be enquired into (on the Day of Reckoning).
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Give full measure when ye measure, and weigh with a balance that is straight: that is the most fitting and the most advantageous in the final determination.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Nor walk on the earth with insolence: for thou canst not rend the earth asunder, nor reach the mountains in height.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: These are among the (precepts of) wisdom, which thy Lord has revealed to thee. Take not, with Allah, another object of worship, lest thou shouldst be thrown into Hell, blameworthy and rejected.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Has then your Lord (O Pagans!) preferred for you sons, and taken for Himself daughters among the angels? Truly ye utter a most dreadful saying!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: We have explained (things) in various (ways) in this Qur'an, in order that they may receive admonition, but it only increases their flight (from the Truth)!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: Say: If there had been (other) gods with Him, as they say,- behold, they would certainly have sought out a way to the Lord of the Throne!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: The seven heavens and the earth, and all beings therein, declare His glory: there is not a thing but celebrates His praise; And yet ye understand not how they declare His glory! Verily He is Oft-Forbear, Most Forgiving!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When thou dost recite the Qur'an, We put, between thee and those who believe not in the Hereafter, a veil invisible:
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And We put coverings over their hearts (and minds) lest they should understand the Qur'an, and deafness into their ears: when thou dost commemorate thy Lord and Him alone in the Qur'an, they turn on their backs, fleeing (from the Truth).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: They say: "What! when we are reduced to bones and dust, should we really be raised up (to be) a new creation?"
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Say to My servants that they should (only) say those things that are best: for Satan doth sow dissensions among them: For Satan is to man an avowed enemy.
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: It is your Lord that knoweth you best: If He please, He granteth you mercy, or if He please, punishment: We have not sent thee to be a disposer of their affairs for them.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And it is your Lord that knoweth best all beings that are in the heavens and on earth: We did bestow on some prophets more (and other) gifts than on others: and We gave to David (the gift of) the Psalms.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Say: "Call on those - besides Him - whom ye fancy: they have neither the power to remove your troubles from you nor to change them."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: There is not a population but We shall destroy it before the Day of Judgment or punish it with a dreadful Penalty: that is written in the (eternal) Record.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: And We refrain from sending the signs, only because the men of former generations treated them as false: We sent the she-camel to the Thamud to open their eyes, but they treated her wrongfully: We only send the Signs by way of terror (and warning from evil).
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Behold! We said to the angels: "Bow down unto Adam": They bowed down except Iblis: He said, "Shall I bow down to one whom Thou didst create from clay?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: (Allah) said: "Go thy way; if any of them follow thee, verily Hell will be the recompense of you (all)- an ample recompense.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: "Lead to destruction those whom thou canst among them, with thy (seductive) voice; make assaults on them with thy cavalry and thy infantry; mutually share with them wealth and children; and make promises to them." But Satan promises them nothing but deceit.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Your Lord is He That maketh the Ship go smoothly for you through the sea, in order that ye may seek of his Bounty. For he is unto you most Merciful.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When distress seizes you at sea, those that ye call upon - besides Himself - leave you in the lurch! but when He brings you back safe to land, ye turn away (from Him). Most ungrateful is man!
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Do ye then feel secure that He will not cause you to be swallowed up beneath the earth when ye are on land, or that He will not send against you a violent tornado (with showers of stones) so that ye shall find no one to carry out your affairs for you?
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Or do ye feel secure that He will not send you back a second time to sea and send against you a heavy gale to drown you because of your ingratitude, so that ye find no helper. Therein against Us?
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: We have honoured the sons of Adam; provided them with transport on land and sea; given them for sustenance things good and pure; and conferred on them special favours, above a great part of our creation.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: One day We shall call together all human beings with their (respective) Imams: those who are given their record in their right hand will read it (with pleasure), and they will not be dealt with unjustly in the least.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: But those who were blind in this world, will be blind in the hereafter, and most astray from the Path.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Their purpose was to scare thee off the land, in order to expel thee; but in that case they would not have stayed (therein) after thee, except for a little while.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: (This was Our) way with the messengers We sent before thee: thou wilt find no change in Our ways.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Establish regular prayers - at the sun's decline till the darkness of the night, and the morning prayer and reading: for the prayer and reading in the morning carry their testimony.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And pray in the small watches of the morning: (it would be) an additional prayer (or spiritual profit) for thee: soon will thy Lord raise thee to a Station of Praise and Glory!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "O my Lord! Let my entry be by the Gate of Truth and Honour, and likewise my exit by the Gate of Truth and Honour; and grant me from Thy Presence an authority to aid (me)."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: We send down (stage by stage) in the Qur'an that which is a healing and a mercy to those who believe: to the unjust it causes nothing but loss after loss.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'ilmu']

Text: Yet when We bestow Our favours on man, he turns away and becomes remote on his side (instead of coming to Us), and when evil seizes him he gives himself up to despair!
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Say: "Everyone acts according to his own disposition: But your Lord knows best who it is that is best guided on the Way."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: They ask thee concerning the Spirit (of inspiration). Say: "The Spirit (cometh) by command of my Lord: of knowledge it is only a little that is communicated to you, (O men!)"
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Say: "If the whole of mankind and Jinns were to gather together to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like thereof, even if they backed up each other with help and support.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And We have explained to man, in this Qur'an, every kind of similitude: yet the greater part of men refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They say: "We shall not believe in thee, until thou cause a spring to gush forth for us from the earth,
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: "Or (until) thou have a garden of date trees and vines, and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst, carrying abundant water;
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: "Or thou cause the sky to fall in pieces, as thou sayest (will happen), against us; or thou bring Allah and the angels before (us) face to face:
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "Or thou have a house adorned with gold, or thou mount a ladder right into the skies. No, we shall not even believe in thy mounting until thou send down to us a book that we could read." Say: "Glory to my Lord! Am I aught but a man,- a messenger?"
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: What kept men back from belief when Guidance came to them, was nothing but this: they said, "Has Allah sent a man (like us) to be (His) Messenger?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Say, "If there were settled, on earth, angels walking about in peace and quiet, We should certainly have sent them down from the heavens an angel for a messenger."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: It is he whom Allah guides, that is on true Guidance; but he whom He leaves astray - for such wilt thou find no protector besides Him. On the Day of Judgment We shall gather, them together, prone on their faces, blind, dumb, and deaf: their abode will be Hell: every time it shows abatement, We shall increase from them the fierceness of the Fire.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: See they not that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, has power to create the like of them (anew)? Only He has decreed a term appointed, of which there is no doubt. But the unjust refuse (to receive it) except with ingratitude.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: To Moses We did give Nine Clear Signs: As the Children of Israel: when he came to them, Pharaoh said to him: "O Moses! I consider thee, indeed, to have been worked upon by sorcery!
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: So he resolved to remove them from the face of the earth: but We did drown him and all who were with him.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: And We said thereafter to the Children of Israel, "Dwell securely in the land (of promise)": but when the second of the warnings came to pass, We gathered you together in a mingled crowd.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: We sent down the (Qur'an) in Truth, and in Truth has it descended: and We sent thee but to give Glad Tidings and to warn (sinners).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (It is) a Qur'an which We have divided (into parts from time to time), in order that thou mightest recite it to men at intervals: We have revealed it by stages.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "Whether ye believe in it or not, it is true that those who were given knowledge beforehand, when it is recited to them, fall down on their faces in humble prostration,
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: "And they say: 'Glory to our Lord! Truly has the promise of our Lord been fulfilled!'"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: They fall down on their faces in tears, and it increases their (earnest) humility.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "Call upon Allah, or call upon Rahman: by whatever name ye call upon Him, (it is well): for to Him belong the Most Beautiful Names. Neither speak thy Prayer aloud, nor speak it in a low tone, but seek a middle course between."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Say: "Praise be to Allah, who begets no son, and has no partner in (His) dominion: Nor (needs) He any to protect Him from humiliation: yea, magnify Him for His greatness and glory!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Praise be to Allah, Who hath sent to His Servant the Book, and hath allowed therein no Crookedness:
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (He hath made it) Straight (and Clear) in order that He may warn (the godless) of a terrible Punishment from Him, and that He may give Glad Tidings to the Believers who work righteous deeds, that they shall have a goodly Reward,
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Further, that He may warn those (also) who say, "Allah hath begotten a son":
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: No knowledge have they of such a thing, nor had their fathers. It is a grievous thing that issues from their mouths as a saying what they say is nothing but falsehood!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: That which is on earth we have made but as a glittering show for the earth, in order that We may test them - as to which of them are best in conduct.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the Inscription were wonders among Our Sign?
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Behold, the youths betook themselves to the Cave: they said, "Our Lord! bestow on us Mercy from Thyself, and dispose of our affair for us in the right way!"
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Then We draw (a veil) over their ears, for a number of years, in the Cave, (so that they heard not):
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then We roused them, in order to test which of the two parties was best at calculating the term of years they had tarried!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: We relate to thee their story in truth: they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We advanced them in guidance:
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: We gave strength to their hearts: Behold, they stood up and said: "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and of the earth: never shall we call upon any god other than Him: if we did, we should indeed have uttered an enormity!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: "These our people have taken for worship gods other than Him: why do they not bring forward an authority clear (and convincing) for what they do? Who doth more wrong than such as invent a falsehood against Allah?
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: "When ye turn away from them and the things they worship other than Allah, betake yourselves to the Cave: Your Lord will shower His mercies on you and disposes of your affair towards comfort and ease."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Thou wouldst have seen the sun, when it rose, declining to the right from their Cave, and when it set, turning away from them to the left, while they lay in the open space in the midst of the Cave. Such are among the Signs of Allah: He whom Allah, guides is rightly guided; but he whom Allah leaves to stray,- for him wilt thou find no protector to lead him to the Right Way.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Thou wouldst have deemed them awake, whilst they were asleep, and We turned them on their right and on their left sides: their dog stretching forth his two fore-legs on the threshold: if thou hadst come up on to them, thou wouldst have certainly turned back from them in flight, and wouldst certainly have been filled with terror of them.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Such (being their state), we raised them up (from sleep), that they might question each other. Said one of them, "How long have ye stayed (here)?" They said, "We have stayed (perhaps) a day, or part of a day." (At length) they (all) said, "Allah (alone) knows best how long ye have stayed here.... Now send ye then one of you with this money of yours to the town: let him find out which is the best food (to be had) and bring some to you, that (ye may) satisfy your hunger therewith: And let him behave with care and courtesy, and let him not inform any one about you.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "For if they should come upon you, they would stone you or force you to return to their cult, and in that case ye would never attain prosperity."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Thus did We make their case known to the people, that they might know that the promise of Allah is true, and that there can be no doubt about the Hour of Judgment. Behold, they dispute among themselves as to their affair. (Some) said, "Construct a building over them": Their Lord knows best about them: those who prevailed over their affair said, "Let us surely build a place of worship over them."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: (Some) say they were three, the dog being the fourth among them; (others) say they were five, the dog being the sixth,- doubtfully guessing at the unknown; (yet others) say they were seven, the dog being the eighth. Say thou: "My Lord knoweth best their number; It is but few that know their (real case)." Enter not, therefore, into controversies concerning them, except on a matter that is clear, nor consult any of them about (the affair of) the Sleepers.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: So they stayed in their Cave three hundred years, and (some) add nine (more)
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: Say: "Allah knows best how long they stayed: with Him is (the knowledge of) the secrets of the heavens and the earth: how clearly He sees, how finely He hears (everything)! They have no protector other than Him; nor does He share His Command with any person whatsoever.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And recite (and teach) what has been revealed to thee of the Book of thy Lord: none can change His Words, and none wilt thou find as a refuge other than Him.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And keep thy soul content with those who call on their Lord morning and evening, seeking His Face; and let not thine eyes pass beyond them, seeking the pomp and glitter of this Life; no obey any whose heart We have permitted to neglect the remembrance of Us, one who follows his own desires, whose case has gone beyond all bounds.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: As to those who believe and work righteousness, verily We shall not suffer to perish the reward of any who do a (single) righteous deed.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: For them will be Gardens of Eternity; beneath them rivers will flow; they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they will wear green garments of fine silk and heavy brocade: They will recline therein on raised thrones. How good the recompense! How beautiful a couch to recline on!
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Set forth to them the parable of two men: for one of them We provided two gardens of grape-vines and surrounded them with date palms; in between the two We placed corn-fields.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: His companion said to him, in the course of the argument with him: "Dost thou deny Him Who created thee out of dust, then out of a sperm-drop, then fashioned thee into a man?
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "It may be that my Lord will give me something better than thy garden, and that He will send on thy garden thunderbolts (by way of reckoning) from heaven, making it (but) slippery sand!-
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: So his fruits (and enjoyment) were encompassed (with ruin), and he remained twisting and turning his hands over what he had spent on his property, which had (now) tumbled to pieces to its very foundations, and he could only say, "Woe is me! Would I had never ascribed partners to my Lord and Cherisher!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: There, the (only) protection comes from Allah, the True One. He is the Best to reward, and the Best to give success.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Set forth to them the similitude of the life of this world: It is like the rain which we send down from the skies: the earth's vegetation absorbs it, but soon it becomes dry stubble, which the winds do scatter: it is (only) Allah who prevails over all things.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Wealth and sons are allurements of the life of this world: But the things that endure, good deeds, are best in the sight of thy Lord, as rewards, and best as (the foundation for) hopes.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: One Day We shall remove the mountains, and thou wilt see the earth as a level stretch, and We shall gather them, all together, nor shall We leave out any one of them.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And they will be marshalled before thy Lord in ranks, (with the announcement), "Now have ye come to Us (bare) as We created you first: aye, ye thought We shall not fulfil the appointment made to you to meet (Us)!":
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: And the Book (of Deeds) will be placed (before you); and thou wilt see the sinful in great terror because of what is (recorded) therein; they will say, "Ah! woe to us! what a Book is this! It leaves out nothing small or great, but takes account thereof!" They will find all that they did, placed before them: And not one will thy Lord treat with injustice.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Behold! We said to the angels, "Bow down to Adam": They bowed down except Iblis. He was one of the Jinns, and he broke the Command of his Lord. Will ye then take him and his progeny as protectors rather than Me? And they are enemies to you! Evil would be the exchange for the wrong-doers!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: I called them not to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor (even) their own creation: nor is it for helpers such as Me to take as lead (men) astray!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: One Day He will say, "Call on those whom ye thought to be My partners," and they will call on them, but they will not listen to them; and We shall make for them a place of common perdition.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And the Sinful shall see the fire and apprehend that they have to fall therein: no means will they find to turn away therefrom.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: We have explained in detail in this Qur'an, for the benefit of mankind, every kind of similitude: but man is, in most things, contentious.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: We only send the messengers to give Glad Tidings and to give warnings: But the unbelievers dispute with vain argument, in order therewith to weaken the truth, and they treat My Signs as a jest, as also the fact that they are warned!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And who doth more wrong than one who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord, but turns away from them, forgetting the (deeds) which his hands have sent forth? Verily We have set veils over their hearts lest they should understand this, and over their ears, deafness, if thou callest them to guidance, even then will they never accept guidance.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But your Lord is Most forgiving, full of Mercy. If He were to call them (at once) to account for what they have earned, then surely He would have hastened their punishment: but they have their appointed time, beyond which they will find no refuge.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Such were the populations we destroyed when they committed iniquities; but we fixed an appointed time for their destruction.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Behold, Moses said to his attendant, "I will not give up until I reach the junction of the two seas or (until) I spend years and years in travel."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But when they reached the Junction, they forgot (about) their Fish, which took its course through the sea (straight) as in a tunnel.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When they had passed on (some distance), Moses said to his attendant: "Bring us our early meal; truly we have suffered much fatigue at this (stage of) our journey."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He replied: "Sawest thou (what happened) when we betook ourselves to the rock? I did indeed forget (about) the Fish: none but Satan made me forget to tell (you) about it: it took its course through the sea in a marvellous way!"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Moses said: "That was what we were seeking after:" So they went back on their footsteps, following (the path they had come).
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: So they found one of Our servants, on whom We had bestowed Mercy from Ourselves and whom We had taught knowledge from Our own Presence.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Moses said to him: "May I follow thee, on the footing that thou teach me something of the (Higher) Truth which thou hast been taught?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (The other) said: "Verily thou wilt not be able to have patience with me!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "And how canst thou have patience about things about which thy understanding is not complete?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Moses said: "Thou wilt find me, if Allah so will, (truly) patient: nor shall I disobey thee in aught."
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: The other said: "If then thou wouldst follow me, ask me no questions about anything until I myself speak to thee concerning it."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: So they both proceeded: until, when they were in the boat, he scuttled it. Said Moses: "Hast thou scuttled it in order to drown those in it? Truly a strange thing hast thou done!"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Then they proceeded: until, when they met a young man, he slew him. Moses said: "Hast thou slain an innocent person who had slain none? Truly a foul (unheard of) thing hast thou done!"
Label: ['syariah', 'ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: He answered: "Did I not tell thee that thou canst have no patience with me?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (Moses) said: "If ever I ask thee about anything after this, keep me not in thy company: then wouldst thou have received (full) excuse from my side."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then they proceeded: until, when they came to the inhabitants of a town, they asked them for food, but they refused them hospitality. They found there a wall on the point of falling down, but he set it up straight. (Moses) said: "If thou hadst wished, surely thou couldst have exacted some recompense for it!"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He answered: "This is the parting between me and thee: now will I tell thee the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "As for the boat, it belonged to certain men in dire want: they plied on the water: I but wished to render it unserviceable, for there was after them a certain king who seized on every boat by force.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "As for the youth, his parents were people of Faith, and we feared that he would grieve them by obstinate rebellion and ingratitude (to Allah and man).
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange (a son) better in purity (of conduct) and closer in affection.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "As for the wall, it belonged to two youths, orphans, in the Town; there was, beneath it, a buried treasure, to which they were entitled: their father had been a righteous man: So thy Lord desired that they should attain their age of full strength and get out their treasure - a mercy (and favour) from thy Lord. I did it not of my own accord. Such is the interpretation of (those things) over which thou wast unable to hold patience."
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They ask thee concerning Zul-qarnain. Say, "I will rehearse to you something of his story."
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: Verily We established his power on earth, and We gave him the ways and the means to all ends.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: One (such) way he followed,
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: Until, when he reached the setting of the sun, he found it set in a spring of murky water: Near it he found a People: We said: "O Zul-qarnain! (thou hast authority,) either to punish them, or to treat them with kindness."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He said: "Whoever doth wrong, him shall we punish; then shall he be sent back to his Lord; and He will punish him with a punishment unheard-of (before).
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "But whoever believes, and works righteousness,- he shall have a goodly reward, and easy will be his task as We order it by our Command."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no covering protection against the sun.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Then followed he (another) way,
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Until, when he reached (a tract) between two mountains, he found, beneath them, a people who scarcely understood a word.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They said: "O Zul-qarnain! the Gog and Magog (People) do great mischief on earth: shall we then render thee tribute in order that thou mightest erect a barrier between us and them?
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He said: "(The power) in which my Lord has established me is better (than tribute): Help me therefore with strength (and labour): I will erect a strong barrier between you and them:
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "Bring me blocks of iron." At length, when he had filled up the space between the two steep mountain-sides, He said, "Blow (with your bellows)" Then, when he had made it (red) as fire, he said: "Bring me, that I may pour over it, molten lead."
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Thus were they made powerless to scale it or to dig through it.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He said: "This is a mercy from my Lord: But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it into dust; and the promise of my Lord is true."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: On that day We shall leave them to surge like waves on one another: the trumpet will be blown, and We shall collect them all together.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And We shall present Hell that day for Unbelievers to see, all spread out,-
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Do the Unbelievers think that they can take My servants as protectors besides Me? Verily We have prepared Hell for the Unbelievers for (their) entertainment.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: "Those whose efforts have been wasted in this life, while they thought that they were acquiring good by their works?"
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: That is their reward, Hell, because they rejected Faith, and took My Signs and My Messengers by way of jest.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: As to those who believe and work righteous deeds, they have, for their entertainment, the Gardens of Paradise,
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Wherein they shall dwell (for aye): no change will they wish for from them.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Say: "If the ocean were ink (wherewith to write out) the words of my Lord, sooner would the ocean be exhausted than would the words of my Lord, even if we added another ocean like it, for its aid."
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Say: "I am but a man like yourselves, (but) the inspiration has come to me, that your Allah is one Allah: whoever expects to meet his Lord, let him work righteousness, and, in the worship of his Lord, admit no one as partner.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Kaf. Ha. Ya. 'Ain. Sad.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (This is) a recital of the Mercy of thy Lord to His servant Zakariya.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Behold! he cried to his Lord in secret,
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Praying: "O my Lord! infirm indeed are my bones, and the hair of my head doth glisten with grey: but never am I unblest, O my Lord, in my prayer to Thee!
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "Now I fear (what) my relatives (and colleagues) (will do) after me: but my wife is barren: so give me an heir as from Thyself,-
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "(One that) will (truly) represent me, and represent the posterity of Jacob; and make him, O my Lord! one with whom Thou art well-pleased!"
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: (His prayer was answered): "O Zakariya! We give thee good news of a son: His name shall be Yahya: on none by that name have We conferred distinction before."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "O my Lord! How shall I have a son, when my wife is barren and I have grown quite decrepit from old age?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "So (it will be) thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: I did indeed create thee before, when thou hadst been nothing!'"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (Zakariya) said: "O my Lord! give me a Sign." "Thy Sign," was the answer, "Shall be that thou shalt speak to no man for three nights, although thou art not dumb."
Label: ['syariah', 'ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: (To his son came the command): "O Yahya! take hold of the Book with might": and We gave him Wisdom even as a youth,
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And piety (for all creatures) as from Us, and purity: He was devout,
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And kind to his parents, and he was not overbearing or rebellious.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: So Peace on him the day he was born, the day that he dies, and the day that he will be raised up to life (again)!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Relate in the Book (the story of) Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place in the East.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: She placed a screen (to screen herself) from them; then We sent her our angel, and he appeared before her as a man in all respects.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: She said: "I seek refuge from thee to (Allah) Most Gracious: (come not near) if thou dost fear Allah."
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "Nay, I am only a messenger from thy Lord, (to announce) to thee the gift of a holy son.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: She said: "How shall I have a son, seeing that no man has touched me, and I am not unchaste?"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: He said: "So (it will be): Thy Lord saith, 'that is easy for Me: and (We wish) to appoint him as a Sign unto men and a Mercy from Us': It is a matter (so) decreed."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: So she conceived him, and she retired with him to a remote place.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And the pains of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm-tree: She cried (in her anguish): "Ah! would that I had died before this! would that I had been a thing forgotten and out of sight!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: But (a voice) cried to her from beneath the (palm-tree): "Grieve not! for thy Lord hath provided a rivulet beneath thee;
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: "So eat and drink and cool (thine) eye. And if thou dost see any man, say, 'I have vowed a fast to (Allah) Most Gracious, and this day will I enter into not talk with any human being'"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: At length she brought the (babe) to her people, carrying him (in her arms). They said: "O Mary! truly an amazing thing hast thou brought!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: "O sister of Aaron! Thy father was not a man of evil, nor thy mother a woman unchaste!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: But she pointed to the babe. They said: "How can we talk to one who is a child in the cradle?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "I am indeed a servant of Allah: He hath given me revelation and made me a prophet;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "And He hath made me blessed wheresoever I be, and hath enjoined on me Prayer and Charity as long as I live;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "(He) hath made me kind to my mother, and not overbearing or miserable;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "So peace is on me the day I was born, the day that I die, and the day that I shall be raised up to life (again)"!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Such (was) Jesus the son of Mary: (it is) a statement of truth, about which they (vainly) dispute.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: It is not befitting to (the majesty of) Allah that He should beget a son. Glory be to Him! when He determines a matter, He only says to it, "Be", and it is.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Verily Allah is my Lord and your Lord: Him therefore serve ye: this is a Way that is straight.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: But warn them of the Day of Distress, when the matter will be determined: for (behold,) they are negligent and they do not believe!
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: It is We Who will inherit the earth, and all beings thereon: to Us will they all be returned.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: (Also mention in the Book (the story of) Abraham: He was a man of Truth, a prophet.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Behold, he said to his father: "O my father! why worship that which heareth not and seeth not, and can profit thee nothing?
Label: ['syariah']

Text: "O my father! to me hath come knowledge which hath not reached thee: so follow me: I will guide thee to a way that is even and straight.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: "O my father! serve not Satan: for Satan is a rebel against (Allah) Most Gracious.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: "O my father! I fear lest a Penalty afflict thee from (Allah) Most Gracious, so that thou become to Satan a friend."
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: (The father) replied: "Dost thou hate my gods, O Abraham? If thou forbear not, I will indeed stone thee: Now get away from me for a good long while!"
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Abraham said: "Peace be on thee: I will pray to my Lord for thy forgiveness: for He is to me Most Gracious.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: When he had turned away from them and from those whom they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and each one of them We made a prophet.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Moses: for he was specially chosen, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And, out of Our Mercy, We gave him his brother Aaron, (also) a prophet.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Also mention in the Book (the story of) Isma'il: He was (strictly) true to what he promised, and he was a messenger (and) a prophet.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: He used to enjoin on his people Prayer and Charity, and he was most acceptable in the sight of his Lord.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Also mention in the Book the case of Idris: He was a man of truth (and sincerity), (and) a prophet:
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And We raised him to a lofty station.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Those were some of the prophets on whom Allah did bestow His Grace,- of the posterity of Adam, and of those who We carried (in the Ark) with Noah, and of the posterity of Abraham and Israel of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever the Signs of (Allah) Most Gracious were rehearsed to them, they would fall down in prostrate adoration and in tears.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: But after them there followed a posterity who missed prayers and followed after lusts soon, then, will they face Destruction,-
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Except those who repent and believe, and work righteousness: for these will enter the Garden and will not be wronged in the least,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Gardens of Eternity, those which (Allah) Most Gracious has promised to His servants in the Unseen: for His promise must (necessarily) come to pass.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: They will not there hear any vain discourse, but only salutations of Peace: And they will have therein their sustenance, morning and evening.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: "Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and of all that is between them; so worship Him, and be constant and patient in His worship: knowest thou of any who is worthy of the same Name as He?"
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: But does not man call to mind that We created him before out of nothing?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: So, by thy Lord, without doubt, We shall gather them together, and (also) the Evil Ones (with them); then shall We bring them forth on their knees round about Hell;
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Then shall We certainly drag out from every sect all those who were worst in obstinate rebellion against (Allah) Most Gracious.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: But how many (countless) generations before them have we destroyed, who were even better in equipment and in glitter to the eye?
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Say: "If any men go astray, (Allah) Most Gracious extends (the rope) to them, until, when they see the warning of Allah (being fulfilled) - either in punishment or in (the approach of) the Hour,- they will at length realise who is worst in position, and (who) weakest in forces!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Has he penetrated to the Unseen, or has he taken a contract with (Allah) Most Gracious?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And they have taken (for worship) gods other than Allah, to give them power and glory!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Instead, they shall reject their worship, and become adversaries against them.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Seest thou not that We have set the Evil Ones on against the unbelievers, to incite them with fury?
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: The day We shall gather the righteous to (Allah) Most Gracious, like a band presented before a king for honours,
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: And We shall drive the sinners to Hell, like thirsty cattle driven down to water,-
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: None shall have the power of intercession, but such a one as has received permission (or promise) from (Allah) Most Gracious.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: They say: "(Allah) Most Gracious has begotten a son!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Indeed ye have put forth a thing most monstrous!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: At it the skies are ready to burst, the earth to split asunder, and the mountains to fall down in utter ruin,
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: That they should invoke a son for (Allah) Most Gracious.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: For it is not consonant with the majesty of (Allah) Most Gracious that He should beget a son.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Not one of the beings in the heavens and the earth but must come to (Allah) Most Gracious as a servant.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: On those who believe and work deeds of righteousness, will (Allah) Most Gracious bestow love.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: So have We made the (Qur'an) easy in thine own tongue, that with it thou mayest give Glad Tidings to the righteous, and warnings to people given to contention.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: But how many (countless) generations before them have We destroyed? Canst thou find a single one of them (now) or hear (so much as) a whisper of them?
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Closer and closer to mankind comes their Reckoning: yet they heed not and they turn away.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Never comes (aught) to them of a renewed Message from their Lord, but they listen to it as in jest,-
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Their hearts toying as with trifles. The wrong-doers conceal their private counsels, (saying), "Is this (one) more than a man like yourselves? Will ye go to witchcraft with your eyes open?"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "My Lord knoweth (every) word (spoken) in the heavens and on earth: He is the One that heareth and knoweth (all things)."
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: "Nay," they say, "(these are) medleys of dream! - Nay, He forged it! - Nay, He is (but) a poet! Let him then bring us a Sign like the ones that were sent to (Prophets) of old!"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (As to those) before them, not one of the populations which We destroyed believed: will these believe?
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Before thee, also, the messengers We sent were but men, to whom We granted inspiration: If ye realise this not, ask of those who possess the Message.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu']

Text: We have revealed for you (O men!) a book in which is a Message for you: will ye not then understand?
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: How many were the populations We utterly destroyed because of their iniquities, setting up in their places other peoples?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Yet, when they felt Our Punishment (coming), behold, they (tried to) flee from it.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Flee not, but return to the good things of this life which were given you, and to your homes in order that ye may be called to account.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: They said: "Ah! woe to us! We were indeed wrong-doers!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: Not for (idle) sport did We create the heavens and the earth and all that is between!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: To Him belong all (creatures) in the heavens and on earth: Even those who are in His (very) Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor are they (ever) weary (of His service):
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: They celebrate His praises night and day, nor do they ever flag or intermit.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Or have they taken (for worship) gods from the earth who can raise (the dead)?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: If there were, in the heavens and the earth, other gods besides Allah, there would have been confusion in both! but glory to Allah, the Lord of the Throne: (High is He) above what they attribute to Him!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: He cannot be questioned for His acts, but they will be questioned (for theirs).
Label: ['ilmu']

Text: Or have they taken for worship (other) gods besides him? Say, "Bring your convincing proof: this is the Message of those with me and the Message of those before me." But most of them know not the Truth, and so turn away.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Not a messenger did We send before thee without this inspiration sent by Us to him: that there is no god but I; therefore worship and serve Me.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they offer no intercession except for those who are acceptable, and they stand in awe and reverence of His (Glory).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: If any of them should say, "I am a god besides Him", such a one We should reward with Hell: thus do We reward those who do wrong.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Do not the Unbelievers see that the heavens and the earth were joined together (as one unit of creation), before we clove them asunder? We made from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And We have set on the earth mountains standing firm, lest it should shake with them, and We have made therein broad highways (between mountains) for them to pass through: that they may receive Guidance.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And We have made the heavens as a canopy well guarded: yet do they turn away from the Signs which these things (point to)!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It is He Who created the Night and the Day, and the sun and the moon: all (the celestial bodies) swim along, each in its rounded course.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Every soul shall have a taste of death: and We test you by evil and by good by way of trial. to Us must ye return.
Label: ['akhlak', 'alam-dunia']

Text: When the Unbelievers see thee, they treat thee not except with ridicule. "Is this," (they say), "the one who talks of your gods?" and they blaspheme at the mention of (Allah) Most Gracious!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Man is a creature of haste: soon (enough) will I show you My Signs; then ye will not ask Me to hasten them!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Say: "Who can keep you safe by night and by day from (the Wrath of) (Allah) Most Gracious?" Yet they turn away from the mention of their Lord.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Or have they gods that can guard them from Us? They have no power to aid themselves, nor can they be defended from Us.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Nay, We gave the good things of this life to these men and their fathers until the period grew long for them; See they not that We gradually reduce the land (in their control) from its outlying borders? Is it then they who will win?
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: We shall set up scales of justice for the Day of Judgment, so that not a soul will be dealt with unjustly in the least, and if there be (no more than) the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it (to account): and enough are We to take account.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: In the past We granted to Moses and Aaron the criterion (for judgment), and a Light and a Message for those who would do right,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: And this is a blessed Message which We have sent down: will ye then reject it?
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We bestowed aforetime on Abraham his rectitude of conduct, and well were We acquainted with him.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: Behold! he said to his father and his people, "What are these images, to which ye are (so assiduously) devoted?"
Label: ['syariah']

Text: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: He said, "Indeed ye have been in manifest error - ye and your fathers."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: He said, "Nay, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, He Who created them (from nothing): and I am a witness to this (Truth).
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: So he broke them to pieces, (all) but the biggest of them, that they might turn (and address themselves) to it.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said, "Who has done this to our gods? He must indeed be some man of impiety!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said, "We heard a youth talk of them: He is called Abraham."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."
Label: ['kisah']

Text: They said, "Art thou the one that did this with our gods, O Abraham?"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: He said: "Nay, this was done by - this is their biggest one! ask them, if they can speak intelligently!"
Label: ['ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: So they turned to themselves and said, "Surely ye are the ones in the wrong!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then were they confounded with shame: (they said), "Thou knowest full well that these (idols) do not speak!"
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (Abraham) said, "Do ye then worship, besides Allah, things that can neither be of any good to you nor do you harm?
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: "Fie upon you, and upon the things that ye worship besides Allah! Have ye no sense?"..
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: They said, "Burn him and protect your gods, If ye do (anything at all)!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: We said, "O Fire! be thou cool, and (a means of) safety for Abraham!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Then they sought a stratagem against him: but We made them the ones that lost most!
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: But We delivered him and (his nephew) Lut (and directed them) to the land which We have blessed for the nations.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: And We bestowed on him Isaac and, as an additional gift, (a grandson), Jacob, and We made righteous men of every one (of them).
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And We made them leaders, guiding (men) by Our Command, and We sent them inspiration to do good deeds, to establish regular prayers, and to practise regular charity; and they constantly served Us (and Us only).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And to Lut, too, We gave Judgment and Knowledge, and We saved him from the town which practised abominations: truly they were a people given to Evil, a rebellious people.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (Remember) Noah, when he cried (to Us) aforetime: We listened to his (prayer) and delivered him and his family from great distress.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: We helped him against people who rejected Our Signs: truly they were a people given to Evil: so We drowned them (in the Flood) all together.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And remember David and Solomon, when they gave judgment in the matter of the field into which the sheep of certain people had strayed by night: We did witness their judgment.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: To Solomon We inspired the (right) understanding of the matter: to each (of them) We gave Judgment and Knowledge; it was Our power that made the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises, with David: it was We Who did (all these things).
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: It was We Who taught him the making of coats of mail for your benefit, to guard you from each other's violence: will ye then be grateful?
Label: ['kisah']

Text: (It was Our power that made) the violent (unruly) wind flow (tamely) for Solomon, to his order, to the land which We had blessed: for We do know all things.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And of the evil ones, were some who dived for him, and did other work besides; and it was We Who guarded them.
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: And (remember) Job, when He cried to his Lord, "Truly distress has seized me, but Thou art the Most Merciful of those that are merciful."
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'ilmu', 'kisah']

Text: So We listened to him: We removed the distress that was on him, and We restored his people to him, and doubled their number,- as a Grace from Ourselves, and a thing for commemoration, for all who serve Us.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And (remember) Isma'il, Idris, and Zul-kifl, all (men) of constancy and patience;
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: We admitted them to Our mercy: for they were of the righteous ones.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And remember Zun-nun, when he departed in wrath: He imagined that We had no power over him! But he cried through the deptHs of darkness, "There is no god but thou: glory to thee: I was indeed wrong!"
Label: ['syariah', 'akhlak', 'ilmu']

Text: So We listened to him: and delivered him from distress: and thus do We deliver those who have faith.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: And (remember) Zakariya, when he cried to his Lord: "O my Lord! leave me not without offspring, though thou art the best of inheritors."
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: So We listened to him: and We granted him Yahya: We cured his wife's (Barrenness) for him. These (three) were ever quick in emulation in good works; they used to call on Us with love and reverence, and humble themselves before Us.
Label: ['syariah', 'kisah']

Text: And (remember) her who guarded her chastity: We breathed into her of Our spirit, and We made her and her son a sign for all peoples.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Verily, this brotherhood of yours is a single brotherhood, and I am your Lord and Cherisher: therefore serve Me (and no other).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Whoever works any act of righteousness and has faith,- His endeavour will not be rejected: We shall record it in his favour.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: But there is a ban on any population which We have destroyed: that they shall not return,
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every hill.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: Then will the true promise draw nigh (of fulfilment): then behold! the eyes of the Unbelievers will fixedly stare in horror: "Ah! Woe to us! we were indeed heedless of this; nay, we truly did wrong!"
Label: ['akhlak', 'kisah']

Text: Verily ye, (unbelievers), and the (false) gods that ye worship besides Allah, are (but) fuel for Hell! to it will ye (surely) come!
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: If these had been gods, they would not have got there! but each one will abide therein.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: There, sobbing will be their lot, nor will they there hear (aught else).
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Those for whom the good (record) from Us has gone before, will be removed far therefrom.
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Not the slightest sound will they hear of Hell: what their souls desired, in that will they dwell.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: The Great Terror will bring them no grief: but the angels will meet them (with mutual greetings): "This is your Day,- (the Day) that ye were promised."
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: The Day that We roll up the heavens like a scroll rolled up for books (completed),- even as We produced the first creation, so shall We produce a new one: a promise We have undertaken: truly shall We fulfil it.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Before this We wrote in the Psalms, after the Message (given to Moses): My servants the righteous, shall inherit the earth."
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Verily in this (Qur'an) is a Message for people who would (truly) worship Allah.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: We sent thee not, but as a Mercy for all creatures.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "What has come to me by inspiration is that your Allah is One Allah: will ye therefore bow to His Will (in Islam)?"
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: "It is He Who knows what is open in speech and what ye hide (in your hearts).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Say: "O my Lord! judge Thou in truth!" "Our Lord Most Gracious is the One Whose assistance should be sought against the blasphemies ye utter!"
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'akhlak']

Text: O mankind! fear your Lord! for the convulsion of the Hour (of Judgment) will be a thing terrible!
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: The Day ye shall see it, every mother giving suck shall forget her suckling-babe, and every pregnant female shall drop her load (unformed): thou shalt see mankind as in a drunken riot, yet not drunk: but dreadful will be the Wrath of Allah.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: And yet among men there are such as dispute about Allah, without knowledge, and follow every evil one obstinate in rebellion!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: About the (Evil One) it is decreed that whoever turns to him for friendship, him will he lead astray, and he will guide him to the Penalty of the Fire.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: O mankind! if ye have a doubt about the Resurrection, (consider) that We created you out of dust, then out of sperm, then out of a leech-like clot, then out of a morsel of flesh, partly formed and partly unformed, in order that We may manifest (our power) to you; and We cause whom We will to rest in the wombs for an appointed term, then do We bring you out as babes, then (foster you) that ye may reach your age of full strength; and some of you are called to die, and some are sent back to the feeblest old age, so that they know nothing after having known (much), and (further), thou seest the earth barren and lifeless, but when We pour down rain on it, it is stirred (to life), it swells, and it puts forth every kind of beautiful growth (in pairs).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: This is so, because Allah is the Reality: it is He Who gives life to the dead, and it is He Who has power over all things.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And verily the Hour will come: there can be no doubt about it, or about (the fact) that Allah will raise up all who are in the graves.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-ghaib', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Yet there is among men such a one as disputes about Allah, without Knowledge, without Guidance, and without a Book of Enlightenment,-
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: (Disdainfully) bending his side, in order to lead (men) astray from the Path of Allah: for him there is disgrace in this life, and on the Day of Judgment We shall make him taste the Penalty of burning (Fire).
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: (It will be said): "This is because of the deeds which thy hands sent forth, for verily Allah is not unjust to His servants.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: There are among men some who serve Allah, as it were, on the verge: if good befalls them, they are, therewith, well content; but if a trial comes to them, they turn on their faces: they lose both this world and the Hereafter: that is loss for all to see!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: They call on such deities, besides Allah, as can neither hurt nor profit them: that is straying far indeed (from the Way)!
Label: ['syariah']

Text: (Perhaps) they call on one whose hurt is nearer than his profit: evil, indeed, is the patron, and evil the companion (or help)!
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Verily Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds, to Gardens, beneath which rivers flow: for Allah carries out all that He plans.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: If any think that Allah will not help him (His Messenger) in this world and the Hereafter, let him stretch out a rope to the ceiling and cut (himself) off: then let him see whether his plan will remove that which enrages (him)!
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Thus have We sent down Clear Signs; and verily Allah doth guide whom He will!
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Those who believe (in the Qur'an), those who follow the Jewish (scriptures), and the Sabians, Christians, Magians, and Polytheists,- Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment: for Allah is witness of all things.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Seest thou not that to Allah bow down in worship all things that are in the heavens and on earth,- the sun, the moon, the stars; the hills, the trees, the animals; and a great number among mankind? But a great number are (also) such as are fit for Punishment: and such as Allah shall disgrace,- None can raise to honour: for Allah carries out all that He wills.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: These two antagonists dispute with each other about their Lord: But those who deny (their Lord),- for them will be cut out a garment of Fire: over their heads will be poured out boiling water.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: With it will be scalded what is within their bodies, as well as (their) skins.
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: In addition there will be maces of iron (to punish) them.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Allah will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds, to Gardens beneath which rivers flow: they shall be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls; and their garments there will be of silk.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: For they have been guided (in this life) to the purest of speeches; they have been guided to the Path of Him Who is Worthy of (all) Praise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: As to those who have rejected (Allah), and would keep back (men) from the Way of Allah, and from the Sacred Mosque, which We have made (open) to (all) men - equal is the dweller there and the visitor from the country - and any whose purpose therein is profanity or wrong-doing - them will We cause to taste of a most Grievous Penalty.
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Behold! We gave the site, to Abraham, of the (Sacred) House, (saying): "Associate not anything (in worship) with Me; and sanctify My House for those who compass it round, or stand up, or bow, or prostrate themselves (therein in prayer).
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: "And proclaim the Pilgrimage among men: they will come to thee on foot and (mounted) on every kind of camel, lean on account of journeys through deep and distant mountain highways;
Label: ['syariah']

Text: "That they may witness the benefits (provided) for them, and celebrate the name of Allah, through the Days appointed, over the cattle which He has provided for them (for sacrifice): then eat ye thereof and feed the distressed ones in want.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: "Then let them complete the rites prescribed for them, perform their vows, and (again) circumambulate the Ancient House."
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Such (is the Pilgrimage): whoever honours the sacred rites of Allah, for him it is good in the Sight of his Lord. Lawful to you (for food in Pilgrimage) are cattle, except those mentioned to you (as exception): but shun the abomination of idols, and shun the word that is false,-
Label: ['syariah']

Text: Being true in faith to Allah, and never assigning partners to Him: if anyone assigns partners to Allah, is as if he had fallen from heaven and been snatched up by birds, or the wind had swooped (like a bird on its prey) and thrown him into a far-distant place.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Such (is his state): and whoever holds in honour the symbols of Allah, (in the sacrifice of animals), such (honour) should come truly from piety of heart.
Label: ['syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: To every people did We appoint rites (of sacrifice), that they might celebrate the name of Allah over the sustenance He gave them from animals (fit for food). But your god is One God: submit then your wills to Him (in Islam): and give thou the good news to those who humble themselves,-
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: To those whose hearts when Allah is mentioned, are filled with fear, who show patient perseverance over their afflictions, keep up regular prayer, and spend (in charity) out of what We have bestowed upon them.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: The sacrificial camels we have made for you as among the symbols from Allah: in them is (much) good for you: then pronounce the name of Allah over them as they line up (for sacrifice): when they are down on their sides (after slaughter), eat ye thereof, and feed such as (beg not but) live in contentment, and such as beg with due humility: thus have We made animals subject to you, that ye may be grateful.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: It is not their meat nor their blood, that reaches Allah: it is your piety that reaches Him: He has thus made them subject to you, that ye may glorify Allah for His Guidance to you and proclaim the good news to all who do right.
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: Verily Allah will defend (from ill) those who believe: verily, Allah loveth not any that is a traitor to faith, or show ingratitude.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: To those against whom war is made, permission is given (to fight), because they are wronged;- and verily, Allah is most powerful for their aid;-
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (They are) those who have been expelled from their homes in defiance of right,- (for no cause) except that they say, "our Lord is Allah". Did not Allah check one set of people by means of another, there would surely have been pulled down monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques, in which the name of Allah is commemorated in abundant measure. Allah will certainly aid those who aid his (cause);- for verily Allah is full of Strength, Exalted in Might, (able to enforce His Will).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: (They are) those who, if We establish them in the land, establish regular prayer and give regular charity, enjoin the right and forbid wrong: with Allah rests the end (and decision) of (all) affairs.
Label: ['syariah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: If they treat thy (mission) as false, so did the peoples before them (with their prophets),- the People of Noah, and 'Ad and Thamud;
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah']

Text: Those of Abraham and Lut;
Label: ['kisah']

Text: And the Companions of the Madyan People; and Moses was rejected (in the same way). But I granted respite to the Unbelievers, and (only) after that did I punish them: but how (terrible) was my rejection (of them)!
Label: ['kisah']

Text: How many populations have We destroyed, which were given to wrong-doing? They tumbled down on their roofs. And how many wells are lying idle and neglected, and castles lofty and well-built?
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Do they not travel through the land, so that their hearts (and minds) may thus learn wisdom and their ears may thus learn to hear? Truly it is not their eyes that are blind, but their hearts which are in their breasts.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Yet they ask thee to hasten on the Punishment! But Allah will not fail in His Promise. Verily a Day in the sight of thy Lord is like a thousand years of your reckoning.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And to how many populations did I give respite, which were given to wrong-doing? in the end I punished them. To me is the destination (of all).
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Say: "O men! I am (sent) to you only to give a Clear Warning:
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: "Those who believe and work righteousness, for them is forgiveness and a sustenance most generous.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak']

Text: "But those who strive against Our Signs, to frustrate them,- they will be Companions of the Fire."
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Never did We send a messenger or a prophet before thee, but, when he framed a desire, Satan threw some (vanity) into his desire: but Allah will cancel anything (vain) that Satan throws in, and Allah will confirm (and establish) His Signs: for Allah is full of Knowledge and Wisdom:
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: That He may make the suggestions thrown in by Satan, but a trial for those in whose hearts is a disease and who are hardened of heart: verily the wrong-doers are in a schism far (from the Truth):
Label: ['kisah', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: Those who reject Faith will not cease to be in doubt concerning (Revelation) until the Hour (of Judgment) comes suddenly upon them, or there comes to them the Penalty of a Day of Disaster.
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: On that Day of Dominion will be that of Allah: He will judge between them: so those who believe and work righteous deeds will be in Gardens of Delight.
Label: ['aqidah', 'akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And for those who reject Faith and deny our Signs, there will be a humiliating Punishment.
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Those who leave their homes in the cause of Allah, and are then slain or die,- On them will Allah bestow verily a goodly Provision: Truly Allah is He Who bestows the best provision.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'akhlak']

Text: Verily He will admit them to a place with which they shall be well pleased: for Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: That (is so). And if one has retaliated to no greater extent than the injury he received, and is again set upon inordinately, Allah will help him: for Allah is One that blots out (sins) and forgives (again and again).
Label: ['akhlak']

Text: That is because Allah merges night into day, and He merges day into night, and verily it is Allah Who hears and sees (all things).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: That is because Allah - He is the Reality; and those besides Him whom they invoke,- they are but vain Falsehood: verily Allah is He, Most High, Most Great.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Seest thou not that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and forthwith the earth becomes clothed with green? for Allah is He Who understands the finest mysteries, and is well-acquainted (with them).
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth: for verily Allah,- He is free of all wants, Worthy of all Praise.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: Seest thou not that Allah has made subject to you (men) all that is on the earth, and the ships that sail through the sea by His Command? He withholds the sky (rain) from failing on the earth except by His leave: for Allah is Most Kind and Most Merciful to man.
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: To every People have We appointed rites and ceremonies which they must follow: let them not then dispute with thee on the matter, but do thou invite (them) to thy Lord: for thou art assuredly on the Right Way.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: If they do wrangle with thee, say, "Allah knows best what it is ye are doing."
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: "Allah will judge between you on the Day of Judgment concerning the matters in which ye differ."
Label: ['alam-akhirat']

Text: Knowest thou not that Allah knows all that is in heaven and on earth? Indeed it is all in a Record, and that is easy for Allah.
Label: ['alam-dunia']

Text: Yet they worship, besides Allah, things for which no authority has been sent down to them, and of which they have (really) no knowledge: for those that do wrong there is no helper.
Label: ['kisah']

Text: When Our Clear Signs are rehearsed to them, thou wilt notice a denial on the faces of the Unbelievers! they nearly attack with violence those who rehearse Our Signs to them. Say, "Shall I tell you of something (far) worse than these Signs? It is the Fire (of Hell)! Allah has promised it to the Unbelievers! and evil is that destination!"
Label: ['alam-dunia', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: O men! Here is a parable set forth! listen to it! Those on whom, besides Allah, ye call, cannot create (even) a fly, if they all met together for the purpose! and if the fly should snatch away anything from them, they would have no power to release it from the fly. Feeble are those who petition and those whom they petition!
Label: ['aqidah', 'ilmu', 'alam-dunia']

Text: No just estimate have they made of Allah: for Allah is He Who is strong and able to Carry out His Will.
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: Allah chooses messengers from angels and from men for Allah is He Who hears and sees (all things).
Label: ['aqidah', 'kisah', 'alam-dunia', 'alam-ghaib']

Text: He knows what is before them and what is behind them: and to Allah go back all questions (for decision).
Label: ['aqidah']

Text: O ye who believe! bow down, prostrate yourselves, and adore your Lord; and do good; that ye may prosper.
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: And strive in His cause as ye ought to strive, (with sincerity and under discipline). He has chosen you, and has imposed no difficulties on you in religion; it is the cult of your father Abraham. It is He Who has named you Muslims, both before and in this (Revelation); that the Messenger may be a witness for you, and ye be witnesses for mankind! So establish regular Prayer, give regular Charity, and hold fast to Allah! He is your Protector - the Best to protect and the Best to help!
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'kisah']

Text: The believers must (eventually) win through,-
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Those who humble themselves in their prayers;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Who avoid vain talk;
Label: ['aqidah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Who are active in deeds of charity;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Who abstain from sex,
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah']

Text: Except with those joined to them in the marriage bond, or (the captives) whom their right hands possess,- for (in their case) they are free from blame,
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: But those whose desires exceed those limits are transgressors;-
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: Those who faithfully observe their trusts and their covenants;
Label: ['aqidah', 'syariah', 'akhlak', 'alam-akhirat']

Text: And who (strictly) guard their prayers;-
